default: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a scholar's pack or (b) a dungeoneer's pack
Leather armor, any simple weapon, and two daggers

subclass.name: Gambler's Delight
subclassFeatures: Kissed by the Goddess of Luck|Pugilist|SterlingVermin|Gambler's Delight|ASS|17

subclassFeature.name: Gun Nerd
entries: You enjoy the feel of hot metal fizzing off in your palms, the smell of gunpowder filling the air, and the booming that ricochets all over before the events. Gun Nerds enjoy all things that there are when it comes to firearms.

subclassFeature.name: Gun Enthusiasm
entries: You gain proficiency in firearms and tinker's tools, and whenever you make a check with either proficiency you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Intelligence Die. If you are already proficient in tinker's tools, you gain proficiency in another set of tools of your choice.
Your mastery over the mechanism of firearms allow you to checks to repair a broken firearm with advantage, and that you ignore the Misfire trait of firearms.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Gun Nerd feature}
Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Parry This, Casual
entries: 'Nuff said: Parry this, casual. You ignore any disadvantage or reductions to your ranged weapon attack rolls made against your Focus and additionally, when your Focus makes an attack roll against a creature within your range, you can expend 2 of your reactions to interrupt them with an attack roll of your own. If your attack roll is higher than theirs, they cannot make their attack and they take damage as if you hit if your attack roll meets their AC.

subclassFeature.name: Follow-up Volley
entries: {@i 10th-level Gun Nerd feature}

You follow-up on the instructions you give out when maximizing damage. When you use your Potent Observation feature, you can expend a piece of ammunition and another reaction as part of the reaction to also deal additional on-hit effects that your firearm does on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Hot Iron Expert
entries: {@i 15th-level Gun Nerd feature}
Your deep fascination with firearms allow you to make finer modifications to them. After the course of a long rest, you may tweak a firearm and give it (or remove) one of the following traits:

items: Burst (1)
Akimbo (13)
Remove Recoil
Remove Misfire

entries: These modifications last for 8 hours and the firearm reverts to its normal state once the duration has passed.

subclassFeature.name: Ninja
entries: Masters of stealth, subterfuge, and schemes. Give them enough time and they can shift the tides of war with just a few clever coordination of contraptions.

subclassFeature.name: Assassin Handiwork
entries: You focus your skillset to expand upon your toolset. You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, rearm traps, or take the Use an Object action. You also gain proficiency in three artisan's tools of your choice, of which you can choose to gain expertise on when you can.
When a creature fails a saving throw and takes damage from an item that you used or a trap that you laid, you can choose to deal your Sneak Attack damage to them.

subclassFeature.name: Mythical Traversal
entries: {@i 9th-level Ninja feature}

You learn to create equipment that would be greatly serve you in long adventures. Over the course of a long rest, you can outfit yourself with a kit that can be concealed underneath your armor and clothes. Choose from one of the following kits:

items: {@b {@i Tengu.}} You fall with a slower pace which you can use the momentum of to glide. When you fall 2 feet downwards, you can move 1 feet in any direction.
{@b {@i Oni.}} You are not affected by extreme weather conditions and you gain advantage on any checks made to scale walls.
{@b {@i Kappa.}} You can hold your breath for 10 minutes and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries: This kit lasts until you create and don a different one over the course of a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Traps
entries: {@i 13th-level Ninja feature}

The traps and tools that you use become more potent. Traps that you lay have a 25% chance of rearming themselves and when you deal Sneak Attack damage using your Assassin Handiwork subclass feature, there is a 5% chance for the target to take doubled damage from it. Additionally, you can add your proficiency bonus to the DC of items that you use.

subclassFeature.name: Handicrafts Preeminence
entries: {@i 17th-level Ninja feature}

When it comes to preparation, with enough time you can take down a castle with just a piece of string and a pebble. Choose a set of tools that you are proficient in, you gain expertise on those tools and you can never fail a check when you make an item using them.

Whenever you craft adventuring gear, you can choose to ignore the material costs as long as the total gp cost is less than 500 gp, 1000 gp if you have expertise on the set of tools being you used. You are considered proficient in weapons or armor that you make.

subclassFeature.name: Gambler's Delight
entries: Betting and losing it all, or winning a century's glory. That is the way of the Gambler's Delight. You enjoy the purest form of gambling, none of that card-counting stuff or pushing pieces around, you simply wish to turn your hand of cards and be in full exhilaration when you find yourself having pocket aces.

entries.subclassFeature: For the Love of the Game|Pugilist|SterlingVermin|Gambler's Delight|ASS|3

subclassFeature.name: Luck? Who Needs That?
entries: You need not tamper your chances, a fair win is much better than anything else that you can force out. You gain 2 luck points as per the Lucky feat but you cannot use any of your luck points outside of loot rolls. For each luck point that you have, you gain a +1 bonus to your damage rolls with an unarmed strike or a pugilist weapon.

subclassFeature.name: For the Love of the Game
entries: You enjoy gambling and games not because you win often, but because you can win and you can lose. You gain proficiency in one gaming set of your choice and when you first enter a settlement, you immediately know establishments that let you play and gamble with gaming sets you are proficient in.

subclassFeature.name: Wheel of Fortune
entries: {@i 6th-level Gambler's Delight feature}

You spin to win, or you gain nothing at all. But after that, you roll some more. At the start of your turn, you can expend a point of moxie and roll a 1d100, you gain a certain benefit or effect according to the table below:

entries.caption: Wheel of Fortune
rows: Your critical hit range increases by 2 during this turn.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC during this turn.
Attacks you make can add your Strength modifier an additional time for damage rolls during this turn.
You find 1 gold piece on the floor.
Strength checks that you make during this turn are made with advantage.
You gain an additional attack when you take the Attack action on this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Flip A Coin
entries: {@i 11th-level Gambler's Delight feature}

Any coin, and unleash a perfect mayhem. Before you make your first attack as part of the Attack action, you can flip a coin. If the coin lands on heads, all attacks you make as part of the Attack action would always hit and none of your attacks hit if the coin lands tails. You can only use this feature three times and you regain all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Kissed by the Goddess of Luck
entries: {@i 17th-level Gambler's Delight feature}
But hated by the God of Death. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright you can drop to 1 hit point instead by expending a luck point.

subclassFeature.name: Blind Swordsman
entries: In exchange for their sight, Blind Swordsmen awaken to a finer control of their precision and instinct which they use to become deadly combatants.

entries.subclassFeature: Ways of the Blind Swordsman|Fighter||Blind Swordsman|ASS|3

subclassFeature.name: Ways of the Blind Swordsman
entries: You learn to open a sense greater than what your eyes can see when open. At the start of your turn, you can choose to give yourself the blinded condition (if you do not yet already have it) until the start of your next turn.
You also gain the Blind Fighting fighting style if you do not yet already have it. If you would already have this fighting style, you may choose a different option to take.

subclassFeature.name: Sightless Fortitude
entries: In exchange for one of your senses, you refine the edge of your intuition and willpower. While you are blinded, you make all Mental saving throws with advantage and Physical saving throws with advantage if the source of it is within your blindsight.

subclassFeature.name: Impaired Forms
entries: {@i 7th-level Blind Swordsman feature}

Carefully observing with a blinded sight, you learn which ways to guide your blade. While you are blinded, you can take on a special stance as an action lasting until your next turn. When you take on one of the stances listed below, you gain a number of reactions equal to how many attacks you can make if you had taken the Attack action but you may only perform the reactions specified by the stance taken.
These are the stances that you can take:

items: {@b {@i Alert Instinct.}} You can only use your reactions to make attacks of opportunity against creatures that move into your range.
{@b {@i Slipstream Edge.}} You can only use your reactions to contest attack rolls targeting you. Roll a melee weapon attack, if your attack rolls exceeds the target's, their attack misses.
{@b {@i Punished Discipline.}} You can only use your reactions to make attacks of opportunity against creatures that target you but only after their attacks are made.

subclassFeature.name: Visionless Shapes
entries: {@i 10th-level Blind Swordsman feature}

The longer you spend with a sense dulled, the stronger you feel your other factors becoming. At the start of your turn, if you choose to blind yourself or you are already suffering the blinded condition, you can choose to gain one of the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls until the end of your turn.
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC until the end of your turn.
You regain one use of your superiority die, if you had any.

subclassFeature.name: Repaired Forms
entries: The stances that you take are at a greater height of mastery. When you take a stance from your impaired forms subclass feature, you gain an additional reaction on top of the number of reactions you get when you take the action. When you take a stance during your turn, you can use your Action Surge to take on another stance. You gain the additional number of reactions as normal, and you can use all of your reactions to perform any of the reactions listed by the stances that you had taken.

subclassFeature.name: Third Eye
entries: {@i 15th-level Blind Swordsman feature}
Your closed eyes open to a sight even greater than before. You gain an additional 10 feet of blindsight on top of what you already have.

subclassFeature.name: Sixth Eyes
entries: {@i 18th-level Blind Swordsman feature}
Not even the wind, the waters, nor the soil shall abade your sight. You gain tremorsense that is equal to the range of your blindsight as long as you are blinded.

subclassFeature.name: Makeshifter
entries: Artificers that use their ingenuity for improvisation are better known as Makeshifters. They create much of their gear shoddily but their speed and efficiency in such is unparalleled.

subclassFeature.name: Makeshifter Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Makeshifter Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Makeshifter Spells
rows: {@spell jono's cosy shack|BDPC}, {@spell terega's treasure map|ABYSS}

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with one artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: DIY Makeshifting
entries: You learn how to make use of your tools on the fly. You can use an action to make progress in crafting an item as if you had spent 2 hours on it. You are treated as if you have 50 gp worth of supplies on hand for the project. Whenever this feature is used, the item being crafted breaks after an hour of it being created. You may only use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and you regain all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Think Fast, Chuck-A-Nut
entries: {@i 5th-level Makeshifter feature}
As you create, you think of ways to use them in quick notice. When you finish crafting an item using your DIY Makeshifting subclass feature, you can immediately use the item as part of the action.

subclassFeature.name: Improvised Sponsorship
entries: {@i 9th-level Makeshifter feature}

No matter what it is you have on hand, you can make the most out of nothing. When using the DIY Makeshifting subclass feature, you are considered to have 150 gp worth of supplies on hand for the project.

subclassFeature.name: Infusion Amalgamations
entries: {@i 15th-level Makeshifter feature}

Your expertise in fast crafts extend to even your more-complicated arcane infusions. You can use your action to infuse a nonmagical object and imbue it with one of your artificer infusions as per the Infuse Item class feature. If the item that you infuse requires attunement, you can immediately attune to it but this feature can only be used once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Big Rig
entries: An artificer who specializes in Big Rigs typically carry the most of their workshop essentials on their back and are equipped with the know-how to quickly set it all up to at least have a semblance of portability. These artificers rely on an apparatus that they set up as out in the field that can be used both as their spellcasting focus but also to enhance their spellcasting.

subclassFeature.name: Big Rig Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Big Rig Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Big Rig Spells
rows: {@spell leomund's tiny hut}, {@spell wall of sand|xge}

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with carpenter's tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Mechanical Apparatus
entries: You learn how to create a mechanical apparatus. Using carpenter's tools or tinker's tools, you can take an action to magically create a Medium mechanism in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of you.

Once you create a mechanism, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. You can have only one mechanism at a time and can't create one while your mechanism is present.

The mechanism is a magical object and is considered as a structure. It weighs 60 lbs and has an AC of 19 and a number of hit points equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier + 5 times your artificer level. It is immune to poison damage and psychic damage, and all conditions. If forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, it automatically fails. If the mending spell is cast on it, it regains 3d8 hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour. You can dismiss it early as an action as long as you are within 5 feet of it.

When you create the mechanism, you determine its appearance and the direction it is facing, which can be shifted an increment clockwise or counterclockwise as an action while within 5 feet of it. You also decide which type it is, choosing from the options on the Mechanical Apparatus table. You also determine its initiative order when you create the mechanism or as a bonus action while within 5 feet of it, the mechanism's initiative can only be set up to your own initiative + your Intelligence modifier or lower.

entries.caption: Mechanical Apparatuses
rows: The apparatus gains a number of charges equal to your Intelligence modifier. While within 5 feet of where the apparatus is facing, a creature of your choice can expend a charge when casting a spell using a spell slot that does not exceed your highest level spell slot, increasing the spell slot level by 1 when cast. The apparatus is reduced to 0 hit points if it no longer has any charges left.

While within 5 feet of where the apparatus is facing, when creatures of your choice make knowledge checks to learn more about a creature and search checks to find a hidden creature, they can treat a lower d20 roll of as your Intelligence modifier + half of your artificer level.
The apparatus serves as Â¾ cover while within 5 feet of where the apparatus is facing and it has a damage threshold equal to Intelligence modifier + half of your artificer level.

subclassFeature.name: Handyman Heart
entries: {@i 5th-level Big Rig feature}

Your expertise in your toolset broadens to a mechanical know-how of objects. You learn the {@spell mending} cantrip. If you already know this cantrip, you learn another cantrip of your choice in the artificer spell list. When you cast mending using an artisan tool as a spellcasting focus, its casting time is an action and its range is 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mobile Machines
entries: {@i 9th-level Big Rig feature}

You learn how to remove the immobile aspect of your mechanical apparatuses. As a bonus action while within 5 feet of it, you can cause your mechanical apparatus to move up to 10 feet in a direction of your choice. This movement is doubled if it is one of the mechanical apparatuses in the table below, which you also learn how to create.

entries.caption: Mobile Machines
rows: The apparatus gains a number of charges equal to your Intelligence modifier. When the apparatus is affected by a spell whose spell slot level is equal to or lower than your maximum spell slot level, the apparatus expends a charge and repeats the effect on creatures within 5 of it. The apparatus is reduced to 0 hit points if it no longer has any charges left.

Creatures can end their turns in the same space that this apparatus occupies. As an action on your turn, you can move this apparatus and all willing creatures occupying its space up to 50 feet as flying speed.
At the start of the apparatus' turn and as a bonus action on your turn, it casts the earth tremor spell at 1st level using your spellcasting modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Consummate Configurations
entries: {@i 15th-level Big Rig feature}
You learn how to tweak your mechanical apparatuses to suit more towards your grander designs. When creating a mechanical apparatus, you can give it any combination of two of the following traits:

items: {@b {@i Resilient Structure.}} The apparatus gains a damage threshold equal to your artificer level.
{@b {@i Scrap Stocks.}} When the mending spell is casted on the apparatus, it regains hit points equal to 2d8 + your Intelligence modifier.
{@b {@i Signal Booster.}} When casting a spell within 100 feet of the apparatus, you can cast the spell as if you are within its space.
{@b {@i Size Upgrade.}} The apparatus becomes Large-sized.
{@b {@i Stable Foundation.}} If an effect forcibly moves the apparatus, the distance moved is reduced by 10 feet. Additionally, the DC for grappling or shoving the apparatus is increased by 5.
{@b {@i Wheels.}} When you cause the mechanical apparatus to be moved, you can increase its movement by up to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Dimension Shredder
entries: The astral sea of Astella is home to many paths unseen by the naked eye, those that follow the primal path of the Dimension Shredder can open these ways with their attunement to the cosmos as they hold a sharp enough edge. As they lay waste upon the lands, these barbarians can hop freely amongst the atmosphere through rifts in space that they carve up and shred down their enemies with a monstrous capacity to hemorrhage.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Escape
entries: You create rifts in space using in your trance-like rampage. The benefits you gain from your rage change to the following:

items: You have advantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.
When you make a melee weapon attack using Dexterity, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases as you level.
You lose the resistances you would gain from raging.
At the start of your turn, you can teleport to any unoccupied space that you can see up to 10 feet of you. This teleport increases in range by 5 feet at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Energy Cycle
entries: The astral energies inside the multidimensional rifts that you create coat your blade. Whenever you would teleport, through your means or others', the next time you land a melee weapon attack during that turn additionally inflicts rupture damage to the target equal to your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your 2nd-level class feature Reckless Attack now benefits melee weapon attack rolls using Dexterity.

subclassFeature.name: Hacked Traverse
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of the Dimension Shredder feature}

While deep inside the multidimensional rifts that you create, you learn a new way to cut up your prey while cloaking yourself in portals. As an action, you can leap to the space in front of you and separate your body into multiple portals up to 30 feet of you. When in this state, you are blinded and deafened and you cannot use any of your actions other than your reaction at any time to exit the portals and make a melee weapon attack. Escaping from a portal removes all portals made by this feature.Â

You create a number of portals equal to your proficiency bonus. Each of these portals have an AC of 10 and their hit points are equal to your current equally divided between all of these portals. If it has to make a saving throw, it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll. It is the same size as you, and it occupies its space.Â Â
When all portals are removed, you lose hit points equal to half of the missing hit points on all of the portals but if a portal has none left, you take full damage for that portal.
If at the start of your next turn and you have at least 3 portals remaining, the attack you make using this feature does not miss and is a critical hit.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Refracted Leap
entries: {@i 10th-level Path of the Dimension Shredder feature}

You learn how to create portals on the fly so that you can close the gap while cutting up a vulnerable target. Before a creature makes an attack towards another creature that you can see within 60 feet of you, you can teleport to an adjacent tile to the attacker and make an attack of opportunity. On a hit, you and the creature targeted by the attacker gain temp hit points equal to your character level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and you regain all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rip Space
entries: {@i 14th-level Path of the Dimension Shredder feature}

The only thing that your targets see of you is the light pouring out of the rifts in space you create as you rip and zip through their flesh. At the start of your turn while raging, you can choose to make a full-blitz set of attacks when you teleport as per the start of turn rage benefit or you exit a portal made using the Hacked Traverse subclass feature. Doing so, all of the attacks you make during this turn gain the benefits of the Energy Cycle subclass feature and you can use your bonus action to make a single melee weapon attack.
You can only use this feature once per rage. On the second time and onwards you use this feature before a long rest, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Scar Seeker
entries: The Path of the Scar Seeker is recklessness given an artform. Glory seekers, thrill hunters and most of the time: absolutely mad. They revel in the damage their bodies take, each scar a tale that is never forgotten.

subclassFeature.name: Dangerous Bravado
entries: While you're raging and not wearing heavy armor, you lose any resistance to all damage types and you cannot benefit from effects that grant you resistance to any damage types.

subclassFeature.name: All In
entries: You gain a bonus to the damage rolls of melee weapon attacks equal to half of the largest amount of damage you have taken in your current rage if you aren't wearing heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Now or Never
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of the Scar Seeker feature}

You can choose one of your attacks when you take the Attack action, that attack has a critical hit range increased by 5. Using this feature provokes an opportunity attack from your target, and their attack has a critical hit range increased by 5. The target can make this attack even if they do not have a reaction to use but does use their reaction if they haven't used it already. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rowdy Rudy
entries: {@i 10th-level Path of the Scar Seeker feature}

When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you use this feature, all creatures within 30 feet of you gain advantage on attack rolls for 1 round. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Witness Me!
entries: {@i 14th-level Path of the Scar Seeker feature}

You can use your action to make the Now or Never attack against all enemies within your reach. Doing so provokes an opportunity attack from each creature as a single target would. If you survive this action, you are healed for half of your maximum hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald (Lolzdux)
entries: All barbarians harbor a fury within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn to transform that rage into a mantle of primal magic, which swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into the forces of nature to create powerful magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect nature. Other storm heralds hone their craft in lodges in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Aura
entries: AYour rage manifests as a stormy aura while you rage. It extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover.

Your aura is aligned with a natural disaster that gives you strength. You may choose whether you embody a wildfire, tornado, tsunami, thunderstorm, or blizzard. You gain abilities linked to your chosen natural disaster at 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.
If your aura's effects require a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

items: {@b {@i Wildfire}}. Your aura becomes alight with roaring flames. At the start of your turn, each creature in your aura takes fire damage equal to half your barbarian level (rounded up). This damage increases to half you barbarian level (rounded up) + your Constitution modifier at 10th level.
At 10th level, your flames nourish you, cauterizing your wounds. At the beginning of your turn, you regain hit points equal to 2d6 + your Constitution modifier.

{@b {@i Tornado}}. A raging whirlwind encircles you. As a reaction, you can impose disadvantage on a ranged weapon attack made targeting a creature in your aura. Additionally, the air currents guide your blade. You may make a melee weapon attack against a target as long as they are in your storm aura. Attacks made this way deal extra damage equal to your Constitution modifier. This increases to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier at 10th level.

At 10th level, your control over the wind becomes greater. You may use a bonus action to force a creature in your aura to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are thrown 20 feet up into the air until the end of their next turn and are considered grappled. You can only affect creatures that are up to one size category larger than you.

{@b {@i Tsunami}}. The radius around you floods as you rage. At the beginning of your rage, each creature in your aura must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they are pulled within 5 feet of you and take 1d6 + your Constitution modifier bludgeoning damage. This damage increases to 2d6 at 10th level. As a bonus action while you are raging, you may force a creature within your aura to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you may push them 10 feet away from you or pull them up to 10 feet closer to you. They take bludgeoning damage equal to your Constitution modifier. This damage increases to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier at 10th level. All displacement effects of this feature can only affect creatures that are up to one size category larger than you.

At 10th level, the whirlpool surrounding you grows in force. A creature must succeed a Strength saving throw when attempting to leave your aura. Additionally, creatures now have disadvantage on their saving throws against the effects of your aura.

{@b {@i Thunderstorm}}. The air around you crackles with electricity. As a bonus action, you can choose a number of creatures that you can see equal to your Constitution modifier, you cannot choose the same creature more than once. These targets must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 1d6 lightning damage. This damage increases to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier at 10th level. Additionally, your reflexes are amplified. You may make opportunity attacks against anyone that moves 5 feet within your aura.

At 10th level, the storm hastens you even further. You deal additional lightning damage equal to your Constitution modifier when making attacks of opportunity. Additionally, when you use your reaction to make an opportunity attack, you may make additional opportunity attacks up to a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier until the start of your turn. You may not target the same creature when doing so.

{@b {@i Blizzard}}. The radius around you becomes coated in frost and ice. Your aura is considered difficult terrain. When you hit with a weapon attack, you deal additional cold damage equal to your Constitution modifier. A creature can only take this damage once per turn and at 10th level, the damage increases to 1d10 + your Constitution modifier. Additionally, once per target per turn, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw on a successful hit. On a failed save, their movement is halved until the end of their next turn.

At 10th level, a layer of ice and frost covers you as armor. You gain temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier at the start of your turn. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes cold damage equal to your Constitution modifier. You lose these hit points when your rage ends.

entries: You may attune to a new natural disaster over the course of a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of the Storm Herald feature}
The storm grants you benefits even when your aura isn't active. The benefits are based on the natural disaster you chose for your Storm Aura.

items: {@b {@i Wildfire.}} You gain resistance to fire damage and you do not suffer the effects of extreme heat. Additionally, as an action, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by anyone else and set it on fire.

{@b {@i Tornado.}} When you take the Dash action, you gain additional feet of movement equals to five times your proficiency bonus and you may elect to fly this distance. If you take flight using this feature and end your turn in the air, you plummet. Additionally, you do not suffer the effects of high altitude environments and you only take halved bludgeoning damage if it is caused by falling.

{@b {@i Tsunami.}} You gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You can also breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. Additionally, if an effect moves you against your will along the ground, the distance is halved and you can use your reaction to not be moved.

{@b {@i Thunderstorm.}} You gain resistance to lightning damage. Additionally, heavy rain and fog no longer obscure your vision and you can make your voice boom, making it audible to a range of 300 feet.

{@b {@i Blizzard.}} You gain resistance to cold damage and you do not suffer the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, as an action, you can touch water and turn a 5-foot cube of it into ice, which melts after 1 minute. This action fails if a creature is in the cube.

subclassFeature.name: Shielding Storm
entries: {@i 10th-level Path of the Storm Herald feature}

You learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect others. Your aura no longer affects those you consider allies. Additionally, each creature of your choice gains the properties of your Storm Soul feature while the creature is in your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Aura
entries: Your Storm Aura gains an additional effect according to the natural disaster it is manifest as.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Storm
entries: {@i 14th-level Path of the Storm Herald feature}

Your storm aura's radius is increased to 20 feet. You can become an even greater vessel for the storm when you rage. When you do so, the duration of your rage is halved but you gain a special ability determined by your natural disaster in addition to your storm aura traits:

items: {@b {@i Wildfire}}. Whenever you are subjected to fire damage, you take none of that damage and regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt of that type.

The purest of flames begin to manifest within you in the beginning of your rage. You focus on generating this energy as if you were concentrating on a spell (but is not considered as such for the purposes of Rage). This energy is released when your concentration ends or if you decide to do so as an action. When this eruption occurs, creature fire damage equal to the total accumulated damage. The base damage is 8d6. If at the end of your turn it has not detonated, or if you use your bonus action to stoke the flame, the damage increases by 1d6.

{@b {@i Tornado}}. Any ranged weapon attacks made targeting a creature in your area is made with disadvantage. Additionally, whenever you make a weapon attack, creatures in your aura take slashing damage equal to your bonus damage from rage + your Constitution modifier. The amount of creatures you can lift up into the air using your bonus action is increased by your Constitution modifier.

{@b {@i Tsunami}}. You may use an action to cause water to swirl around a number of creatures equal to your Constitution modifier within your storm aura, completely engulfing them with water. They must make a Strength saving throw or be restrained and completely encased in water. At the end of each of your turns, they take 2d10 bludgeoning damage and can repeat their save. This watery prison disappears when your rage ends.

{@b {@i Thunderstorm}}. Whenever you make an attack during your turn, you can target another creature, other than your original target, inside of your storm as part of that attack. Additionally, your walking speed is increased by 5 times your Constitution modifier.
{@b {@i Blizzard}}. Whenever you are subjected to cold damage, you take none of that damage and regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt of that type.

The purest of frost begin to manifest within you in the beginning of your rage. You focus on generating this energy as if you were concentrating on a spell (but is not considered as such for the purposes of Rage). Your protective frost grows like a never-ending blizzard. When rolling for temporary hit points at the beginning of your turn, you can choose whether to keep the temporary hit points you just rolled or add half of it to what you already have. When a creature takes cold damage from making a melee weapon attack against you, they instead take cold damage equal to the temporary hit points you had before taking damage.

entries: At the end of this transformative rage, you gain two points of exhaustion.

subclassFeature.name: College of Condescension
entries: Sometimes, some people just don't want to see others succeed and they thrive off of that negativity. The College of Condescension specializes in reducing the chances of success for others and even benefiting from their failure.

subclassFeature.name: Increasing Ratio of Losses
entries: You really don't care if your allies begin to cope, seethe, or begin to bald, you find enjoyment in their misery. Whenever a creature that has your Bardic Inspiration die succeeds on a clash or a contested check, you can use your reaction to expend their Bardic Inspiration die (if they kept it) to force them and their opponent to reroll both of their results. If the creature that had your Bardic Inspiration die fails because of this feature, you gain a use of your highest level spell slot for 1 minute even if you have not expended it yet.

subclassFeature.name: Scarring Mockery
entries: Your vicious words become more cutthroat. The vicious mockery cantrip is empowered for you and has the following benefits:

items: The spell's damage rolls are increased to d8s rather than d4s.

You can increase the spell's damage by rolling and expending a Bardic Inspiration die. The target and all creatures adjacent to it take psychic damage equal to the resulting roll + your Charisma modifier.

When a creature that has taken damage from this spell rolls a saving throw, you can change the saving throw to a Charisma save. This effect can only happen once until the end of the creature's next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Condescension and Condemnation
entries: {@i 6th-level College of Condescension feature}

The jeers you hurl are screeching for the soul. You learn the bane spell which does not count towards your spells known. Whenever a creature rolls a die that reduces their resulting rolls such as a rerolling effect or the effects of the bane spell, they take psychic damage equal to the difference between the old and the new results + your Charisma modifier.

entries.subclassFeature: Popcorn For The Crowd, Tea For The Self|Bard||Condescension|ASS|6

subclassFeature.name: Popcorn For The Crowd, Tea For The Self
entries: Your efforts can be utilized in a way that allows for more opportunities for your own twisted self-satisfaction. When you roll initiative, you can choose to expend any number of Bardic Inspiration dice and convert them into Clash Opportunities for the party.

subclassFeature.name: Blissful Malapert
entries: {@i 14th-level College of Condescension feature}

Your sanguine entertainment lets out a howl even from the very gods and goddesses of torment. Whenever an allied creature fails an attack roll, saving throw, ability check, clash, or takes a critical hit, or is knocked unconscious, you can expend a Bardic Inspiration die as a reaction. In doing so, you gain an additional action on your next turn. That action can be used only to take the Attack, Cast a Spell (bypassing the one spell on a turn limitation), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

subclassFeature.name: College of Praises
entries: Stirring upon the confidence of their party, bards who master the craft of stroking egos can turn any normal adventurer into a hero. The College of Praises specializes in pepping up allies after even the most minor of victories such as a won contest of skill or a successful desperate attack. They even have the capabilities of tipping the odds of a cinematic clash into their favor.

subclassFeature.name: Fanfaring Sibyl
entries: Your cheers extol the virtues of your colleagues in the most dire of situations. Whenever your Bardic Inspiration die is used on a clash or a contested check, the die used for it is a tier higher (a d6 becomes a d8, a d8 becomes a d10, a d10 becomes a d12, and a d12 becomes a 2d6).
Beginning at 14th level, this feature grants an additional benefit: Whenever your Bardic Inspiration die is used on a clash or a contested check, the creature can keep the Bardic Inspiration die.

subclassFeature.name: Merry Victories
entries: Your mic hype skills are top notch. Whenever your Bardic Inspiration die is used to perform a successful ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to give the same creature that you used your Bardic Inspiration another die.

subclassFeature.name: Praises and Protection
entries: {@i 6th-level College of Praises feature}

The praises you sing rejuvenate the soul. You learn the {@spell bless} spell which does not count towards your spells known. Whenever a creature rolls for an additional die that you gave to them such as a Bardic Inspiration die or the effects of the bless spell, they regain hit points equal to the resulting roll + your Charisma modifier. A creature can only regain hit points through this feature from the same effect once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Trumpeter of Champions
entries: You herald the changing tides of conflict. When you roll initiative, the party gains a Clash Opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Twofold Heroics
entries: {@i 14th-level College of Praises feature}

You sing glorious victories and celebrations for those betrothed by the gods and goddesses of virtue and luck. As a reaction to a creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you succeeding either a saving throw, a contested check that they did not initiate, a clash, or land a critical hit, you can sing their praises and rejuvenate their strengths to stir their efforts once more. Doing so, they can take their turn after the current turn has finished.
You may only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fanfaring Sibyl
entries: Whenever your Bardic Inspiration die is used on a clash or a contested check, the creature can keep the Bardic Inspiration die.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Ichor
entries: Druids revere nature above all, whether it be the very forces of it or entities with a transcendent union to nature itself. But there are also those that call on life from life itself. Druids of the Circle of Ichor draw either their own or others' blood to enhance their mystical link to nature and their own physical forms.

subclassFeature.name: Redwood Sap
entries: You gain the ability to grant yourself strength through the fallen essence of others. As an action, you can sap away the strength of another creature that you can touch as long as their current hit points are below their hit point maximum. It must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they reduce a Physical ability score of your choice by 1. While a creature has their ability scores reduced through this feature, your respective Physical ability scores are also increased equal to how much in total is lost for those ability scores.

The effects of this feature on a creature can only last for 1 minute or if their hit points are at its current maximum or you are knocked unconscious. A creature can only have each of their ability scores reduced by up to a maximum of 2 points, 3 at 5th level, 4 at 9th level, 5 at 13th level, and 6 at 17th level. You can only raise your ability scores up to the same maximum and they cannot exceed 20.
You suffer one level of exhaustion after you lose all ability score increases from this feature and you can only use this feature again after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Essence of the Moon Vine
entries: {@i 6th-level Circle of Ichor feature}

Your accumulated ichor affects even your bestial forms. When using your Wild Shape, the maximum CR of the creature that you transform to increases by up to a third of your total ability score increase from your Redwood Sap class feature. The CR of the beast shapes that you take can also be increased up to the maximum CR you can transform to. Your attacks in beast form count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage as long as your Wild Shape feature's CR maximum is raised by at least 1.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Bloodflow
entries: {@i 10th-level Circle of Ichor feature}

The blood coursing through your veins become more akin to the Primordial Beings that can freely set the laws of nature at a whim. Your spellcasting modifier for this class increases by 1 for every 6 ability score increases from your Redwood Sap class feature.

Whenever your current hit points are below your hit points maximum, you can use your body as a druidic focus. In addition, when casting a druid spell that requires a costly material component, you treat this feature's spellcasting modifier increases as an equivalent of 300 gp.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Bioessence
entries: {@i 14th-level Circle of Ichor feature}

You become a master of the ichor within all living beings. You can cast the locate creature spell at will and you learn which realm the creature originally belongs to. In addition, your Redwood Sap class feature is improved in the following ways:

items: When a creature fails the saving throw, you can reduce their Physical ability score of your choice by 1 up to 3 times.
Your own ability scores can now exceed 20, up to 22, using the feature.
You no longer require to finish a long rest to use the feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer (Lolzdux)
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Arcane Archers are some of the most elite warriors among the elves. They stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

subclassFeature.name: Infused Weapon
entries: You learn a ritual that allows you to infuse a weapon with arcane energy. The weapon must have the Ammunition property. You perform the ritual over the course of 8 hours, which can be done during a long rest. The weapon must be within your reach throughout the ritual, at the conclusion of which you touch the weapon and instill upon it the arcane.
When making an attack with that weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You can only have one weapon infused at a time. If you attempt to infuse another weapon, you must remove the enchantment with the weapon infused beforehand.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer (Lolzdux) Spellcasting
entries: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells.
{@b {@i Cantrips.}} You learn cantrips according to your Arcane Shots.

{@b {@i Spell Slots.}} The Arcane Archer Lolzdux Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your wizard spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

items: For example, if you know the 1st-level spell shield and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast shield using either slot.

entries: {@b {@i Preparing and Casting Spells.}} You know all spells with schools of magic that you have Arcane Shots for, and are of a level for which you have spell slots. You prepare the list of arcane archer spells that are available for you to cast. When you do so, choose a number of known spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your fighter level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

{@b {@i Spellcasting Ability.}} Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your spells. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: You learn to store and unleash special magical effects with your ammunition. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see 'Arcane Shot Options' below) and learn another at 7th level, 10th level, 15th level, and 18th level.

You can have a number of Arcane Shots equal to your proficiency bonus and an Arcane Shot lasts for 24 hours. On a short or long rest, you can create 1st-level Arcane Shots up to your maximum amount. Additionally, you can expend a spell slot to gain a use of your Arcane Shot with an equal power as the spell slot expended as a bonus action.
When creating an Arcane Shot, you also designate its school of magic.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: When you make a ranged weapon attack that has the Ammunition property, you can expend an Arcane Shot to serve as your ammunition for that attack. Your Arcane Shots induce a magical effect, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
You use the Spell save DC of this class if an option requires a saving throw.
When you roll for the initial additional damage of an Arcane Shot, you increase it by 1d6 per spell slot level used to create the Arcane Shot.
{@b {@i Abjured Arrow.}} You study {@filter abjuration|spells|school=a} and its emphasis in magic that blocks, banishes, or protects. You learn the {@spell resistance} cantrip.

items: A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 force damage and must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished this way, the target can't move and is incapacitated. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the nearest unoccupied space it vacated.

entries: {@b {@i Conjured Arrow.}} You study {@filter conjuration|spells|school=c} and its knack for magics that summon and dislocate objects. You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip.

items: A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 bludgeoning damage, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be grappled for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end being grappled on a success, or take 2d6 bludgeoning on a failed save.

entries: {@b {@i Divined Arrow.}} You study {@filter divination|spells|school=d} and its magical gift to predict and change timeline events. You learn the {@spell guidance} cantrip.

items: This arrow travels towards a target you have seen within the past minute, ignoring corners, half-cover, three-quarters cover, and disadvantage of attacking at long range. A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage, and you become aware of its location.

entries: {@b {@i Enchanted Arrow.}} You study {@filter enchantment|spells|school=e} and its ability to magically coerce and beguile creatures. You learn the {@spell friends} cantrip.

items: A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 2d6 psychic damage and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by one target of your choice within 60 feet of it until the end of your next turn.

entries: {@b {@i Evoked Arrow.}} You study {@filter evocation|spells|school=v} and its talent for magics that replicate elemental energy. You learn the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip.

items: This arrow splits around the target. Make an attack with this arrow against each different target of your choice within 10 feet of the original target. A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 damage. The damage type is either acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice).

entries: {@b {@i Illusory Arrow.}} You study {@filter illusion|spells|school=i} and its magical tracks to conceal what is real from the unreal. You learn the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip.

items: A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 thunder damage, and it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be blinded or deafened (your choice) and be unable to speak until the end of your next turn.

entries: {@b {@i Necrotic Arrow.}} You study {@filter necromancy|spells|school=n} and its mastery over magic-inducing fear, death, and decay. You learn the {@spell spare the dying} cantrip.

items: A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened by one target of your choice within 60 feet of it until the end of your next turn.

entries: {@b {@i Transmuted Arrow.}} You study {@filter transmutation|spells|school=t} and its magical knowledge to alter energy and matter. You learn the {@spell mending} cantrip.

items: This arrow travels in a straight line towards the target. Make an attack with this arrow against each different target of your choice in its trajectory, ignoring cover. A target hit by this arrow takes an extra 1d6 piercing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Infused Weapon
entries: {@i 7th-level Arcane Archer feature}
The enchantment you place upon your Infused Weapon becomes greater. You gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon and ammunition used with it counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
The damage type of the weapon and ammunition used with it can be converted to force on a hit.

You can cause the ammunition to release the effect of one cantrip you learned from this subclass, such as apply guidance on the target it hits, or shower sparks with prestidigitation (you must maintain concentration on the cantrip if required).
You can cause the ammunition to deal no damage or non-lethal damage on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Incantation
entries: {@i 10th-level Arcane Archer feature}

You study your ammunitionâ€™s capabilities as an arcane conduit. As an action, make a ranged weapon attack and choose a spell for which you have spell slots for, it must also be a spell that you can cast as either an action or a bonus action. The spell slot is then consumed. On a hit, the creature is then the focused target of the spell that you had casted alongside the attack.
The creature automatically fails the saving throw for the spell if it requires one and is automatically hit if the spell has an attack roll. You must maintain concentration on the spell if required.
If used with an Arcane Shot, the spell casted through this feature would trigger before it.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Arcane Shot
entries: {@i 15th-level Arcane Archer feature}
You can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage rolls of an attack you made with an Arcane Shot.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Fire
entries: {@i 18th-level Arcane Archer feature}
You can spend one use of your Action Surge feature to cast the swift quiver spell.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Improved Arcane Shot
entries: {@i 18th-level Arcane Archer feature}
You can also add your proficiency bonus to the damage rolls of an attack you made with an Arcane Shot.

subclassFeature.name: Banneret (Lolzdux)
entries: A Banneret inspires greatness in others by committing brave deeds in battle. The mere presence of a banneret in a hamlet is enough to cause some orcs and bandits to seek easier prey. A lone banneret is a skilled warrior, but a banneret leading a band of allies can transform even the most poorly equipped militia into a ferocious war band.

A banneret prefers to lead through deeds, not words. As a banneret spearheads an attack, the banneret's actions can awaken reserves of courage and conviction in allies that they never suspected they had.

subclassFeature.name: Banneret's Resourcefulness
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@filter artisan's tools|items|type=artisan's tools|category=} of your choice and over the course of a long rest, you can use your tools to create a banner fit for your weaponry.

subclassFeature.name: Wave Thy Flag
entries: You are no longer just a warrior, you carry and wave thy flag in the battlefield roust those alongside you. You can mount a flag or any other symbolic items to your weapon, as long as it has the Two-Handed property, turning it into your banner. With this banner in your hands, you inspire your allies or even instill fear into your enemies.

{@b {@i Rallies.}} You learn three rallying cries, which are listed under 'Rallying Cries' below. You learn an additional rallying cry whenever you gain a new subclass feature from the Banneret. These rallying cries instill a certain effect to creatures, other than you, within 30 feet of you in the battlefield as long as they can see or hear you and are not unconscious.

items: They may only be performed as a bonus action after you take the Attack action on your turn.

entries: {@b {@i Morale Dice.}} You have morale dice equal to your Charisma modifier, which are d8s. A morale die is expended when you a rallying cry. You regain all of your expended morale dice when you finish a short or long rest.
{@b {@i Saving Throws.}} Some of your rallies require your target to make a saving throw to resist the rally's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Cries
entries: {@b {@i Not Yet Over.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They regain hit points equal to two rolls of your morale die + your Charisma modifier.
{@b {@i Stand Against The Tide.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They gain temporary hit points equal to a roll of your morale die + your Charisma modifier.
{@b {@i Hold Steady.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They gain a bonus to their AC equal to a roll of your morale die until the start of your next turn.
{@b {@i Get Into Formation.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They can immediately move up to their speed as long as they do not exit your range.

{@b {@i Wrasslin' Time.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They gain a bonus to their next Athletics (Strength) check equal to a roll of your morale die + your Charisma modifier until the start of your next turn.

{@b {@i Ready, Aim, Fire.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They gain a bonus to their next attack roll equal to a roll of your morale die + your Charisma modifier.
{@b {@i Focus.}} Choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. Their spellcasting modifier is increased by 1 until the start of your next turn.
{@b {@i Press The Attack.}} Choose an allied creature. They can immediately make a weapon attack as a reaction. On a hit, they deal extra damage equal to your morale die + your Charisma modifier.

{@b {@i Come At Me.}} Choose a number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, any attacks or similar actions that they make will be targeted on you. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

{@b {@i Hesitate.}} Choose a number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, their movement is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

{@b {@i Quake In Fear.}} Choose a number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. They must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are frightened of you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: A Questionable Weapon on the Battlefield
entries: {@i 7th-level Banneret feature}
Your proficiency with your banner allows you to not only strike with it better, but also protect yourself. When you hold your banner and you are not unconscious, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to AC.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls using your banner weapon.
Your banner weapon gains the Light and Finesse properties.
At the start of your turn, if you use a rallying cry during your previous turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to a roll of your morale die + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Banneret's Spirit
entries: {@i 10th-level Banneret feature}

Your prowess as a banneret greatens, the voice of your flag reaches even further away. The range for your rallying cries is doubled and any that require a saving throw has its DC increased by 2, and the amount of morale dice you have is equal to double your Charisma modifier and are turned into d10s.

subclassFeature.name: Martyrdom
entries: {@i 15th-level Banneret feature}

Your banner builds an even greater gusto within your allies, and an even greater dread within your foes as you show an unwavering resolve before death's door. If your hit points are equal to or lower than a quarter of your maximum, you do not need to expend any morale dice to perform your rallying cries and you no longer require taking the Attack action beforehand to perform them.
Additionally, if you only have 1 hit point remaining, you may perform an additional rallying cry when you perform one.

subclassFeature.name: Saint of Silk and Cloth
entries: {@i 18th-level Banneret feature}
Your own marvels transcends your banner. You no longer require your banner to perform your rallying cries. Additionally, you can extend certain features of the Fighter class to your allies.

{@b {@i Second Wind.}} When you use Second Wind, you also rejuvenate your allies, provided that they are within range of your Rallies and can see or hear you. They are healed the same amount of hit points that you regain from the class feature.

{@b {@i Action Surge.}} When you use Action Surge, you may instead forego its effects and instead have an allied creature within range of your Rallies that can see or hear you benefit from it during their turn.

{@b {@i Indomitable.}} When you use Indomitable, you can choose a number of allied creatures equal to your Charisma modifier as long they are within range of your Rallies, can see or hear you, and has also failed their saving throw against the same effect. They can reroll their saving throw and must use the new roll.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Scrollbound Tenets
entries: When it comes to discipline, both monks and wizards are equal in their regiment of honing themselves. These monks combine the wizardly ways to their monastic martial arts in a way that allows them to cycle the leylines of magic into their very veins.

subclassFeature.name: Scrollbound Tenets Spellcasting
entries: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells.
{@b {@i Cantrips.}} You learn three cantrips of your choice. You learn an additional cantrip of your choice at 7th level, 10th level, 13th level, and 19th level.

{@b {@i Spell Slots.}} The Scrollbound Tenets Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your wizard spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

{@b {@i Preparing and Casting Spells.}} You know three 1st-level wizard spells of your choice and the Spells Known column of the Scrollbound Tenets Spellcasting table shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher.

items: The Scrollbound Tenets Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of spells from your known spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your monk level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of spells requires time spent studying your known spells and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries: {@b {@i Spellcasting Ability.}} Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your spells. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Scrivening Strokes
entries: Your discipline and practice leads you to mastery of not just martial arts but also the arcane practices as well. You gain proficiency in Arcana and you can comprehend and use spell scrolls whose spell is not on your class's spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Arcanum Resonance
entries: You learn to tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself and beyond the mystic energy of ki. You can transform unexpended ki points into one spell slot as a bonus action on your turn. The cost of creating a spell slot of a given level is equal to the spell slot level + 2.

subclassFeature.name: Incanted Veins
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of the Scrollbound Tenets feature}
You learn how to weave the most stable of your spells into your martial arts. When you use an action to cast a spell using a spell slot, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

Additionally, you gain a new way to cast your cantrips. When you cast a cantrip that deals damage on your turn, you can expend a spell slot. The spell's effect follows the spell slot level that you used to cast it instead of your character level. For 1 minute, you concentrate and retain the lingering magics of the spell that you casted into your veins, causing them to evoke the spell's effects on the target after a successful hit using your unarmed strikes once per turn. While under these effects, the unarmed strikes you make can use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, and they gain the Reach property. This effect ends early if you are knocked unconscious, or if this spell effect is forcibly removed from you, or until you lose your concentration.

subclassFeature.name: Worldly Possessions, Spiritual Bounties
entries: {@i 11th-level Way of the Scrollbound Tenets feature}

Your harmony with the equipment you wield reaches a greater height. You can attune to magic items that require you to be a wizard and any bonuses that you add to your spell attack rolls is applied to your unarmed strikes' attack and damage rolls and bonuses to your spell saving throw DC is applied to your ki save DC (bonuses to your spellcasting modifier applies it to both unarmed strikes and ki save DC). Additionally, you gain a bonus to your unarmed strikes' damage rolls equal to how many magic items that you are currently attuned to.

subclassFeature.name: Mountain of Knowledge
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of the Scrollbound Tenets feature}

Your mind has established a complete and unyielding link to the very leylines of magic itself. You can memorize any spell as long as you have access to its written form. For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours. Once a spell has been memorized, you can have them as available options for when you prepare your spell list and crafting spell scrolls. Additionally, once you have a spell memorized, you no longer need to make a check to successfully cast it using a spell scroll.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Warfare Ascetic
entries: A monk specialization wherein its practitionersÂ see themselves in tune with the weapons they arm themselves with and the tactics they employ like a natural harmony.

subclassFeature.name: Art of Blade
entries: Your special martial arts training leads you to master the use of weaponry and armors. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in martial weapons, light, medium, and heavy armors, and shields.
While wearing armor or donning a shield, you only gain half of the bonuses of your Unarmored Movement class feature and none while doing both.

When your Strength ability score reaches certain points, you allow yourself more options when it comes to monk weapons. At 13 Strength, you can have ranged and martial weapons as monk weapons. At 15 Strength, you can have weapons that have the Two-Handed property as monk weapons. At 17 Strength, you can have weapons that have the Heavy or Special properties as monk weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Higher Martial Prowess
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of the Warfare Ascetic feature}
Your fighting style combines physicality and wit. You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

{@b {@i Maneuvers.}} You prepare a number of maneuvers equal to your Wisdom modifier on a short rest. As a monk following the Way of the Warfare Ascetic, you have access to two special maneuvers which are the following:

items: {@b {@i Crouching Tiger.}} When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to strike in a way that quells your foe's flames while stoking yours. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll and you regain 1 ki point.

{@b {@i Hidden Dragon.}} When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to swiftly maneuver yourself into a more advantageous position. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll and you can move up to your unarmored movement bonus without expending any movement.

entries: {@b {@i Superiority Dice.}} You have four superiority dice, which are d6s or your Martial Arts die. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
{@b {@i Saving Throws.}} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. Your Ki save DC is used for your maneuvers.

subclassFeature.name: Cavalier
entries: {@i 11th-level Way of the Warfare Ascetic feature}

Your mastery as a rider becomes apparent. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you're not incapacitated.
Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Harmonious Tactics
entries: Your decisions in combat now blend into a self-supporting harmony. Depending on the Action that you take on the previous turn, you start your turn with a certain benefit which are as follows:

items: {@b {@i Attack.}} You have a 10% chance of gaining an expended superiority die.
{@b {@i Dash.}} You double your Unarmored Movement bonus.
{@b {@i Disengage.}} Attacks of opportunities targeting you are made with disadvantage.
{@b {@i Dodge.}} The first attack that you take has its damage halved.

entries: Benefits from this feature last until the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Stances Of A Cyclical Seam
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of the Warfare Ascetic feature}

Your mastery of weapons draw upon its potential starting from its wielder to the very make of the blade. At the start of your turn, you can choose to expend 2 ki points to take on a stance which lasts until the start of your next turn. Taking on a stance grants your unarmed strikes and monk weapons a specified weapon property when making attacks with them. The stances that you can take are the following:

items: {@b {@i Heavy Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Heavy weapon property.
{@b {@i Long Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Reach weapon property but if it already has a range through weapon properties such as Ammunition and Thrown, both ranges are doubled instead.
{@b {@i Flighting Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Thrown weapon property. The short range for it is up to 30 feet and its long range is up to 90 feet. This stance does not work with unarmed strikes.

{@b {@i Adaptive Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Adaptive weapon property which allows you to take attacks of opportunity without using your reaction, if you take an attack of opportunity, you cannot use any other types of reactions until you regain your reaction.
{@b {@i Deadly Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Deadly weapon property which increases your critical hit range by 1.

{@b {@i Sweeping Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Sweeping weapon property which allows you to deal damage to creatures that are adjacent to your target. The damage dealt is your attack's damage roll, halved + the ability score modifier used.

{@b {@i Swaying Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Swaying weapon property which allows you to move your target 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.
{@b {@i Leeching Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Leeching weapon property which lets you regain 3 hit points.

{@b {@i Hurtful Stance.}} Your attacks gain the Hurting weapon property which has a different effect depending on your attack's primary damage dice. If it deals bludgeoning damage, the target's movement is reduced by 5, if the creature's movement is halved through this feature, they are knocked prone. If it deals piercing damage, the target's AC is reduced by 1, this does not stack. If it deals slashing damage, the creature takes bleed damage equal to half of your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Soul
entries: The stars from above, the stellar fabric of space, and the odd phenomena of the cosmic layers have integrated a mote of their astral potential into your soul. Having such a soul has given your very breath a tinge of cosmic energies.

subclassFeature.name: Starlit Strength
entries: The power of the cosmos flow through your body, reinforcing it. Your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
Additionally, your body is reinforced by starlight. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Powers
entries: Choose between the two specializations for your Cosmic Soul. You add spells that are not on the sorcerer spell list to yours if they have a cosmic spell {@filter special interaction|optionalfeatures|feature type=cosmic spell (void);cosmic spell (spectrum);cosmic spell (any)} with the chosen specialization.

items: {@b {@i Void.}} You call upon the power of the Void. You emit a constant pull that deletes all that it touches, even magic itself.
{@b {@i Spectrum.}} You call upon the power of the Spectrum. Your very magics draw upon the energies of the various planes and cosmos through the manifestation of rifts in reality.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Spell
entries: {@i 3rd-level Cosmic Soul feature}
As a Cosmic Soul sorcerer, you gain a specialized metamagic of your own at 3rd level.

{@b Cosmic Spell.} When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can spend sorcery points equal to the spell slot used to cast the spell to draw upon the power of the cosmos alongside it to alter its effects in accordance to your Cosmic Power. The full list of these special effects can be seen {@filter here|optionalfeatures|feature type=cosmic spell (void);cosmic spell (spectrum);cosmic spell (any)} but if a spell doesn't have a special interaction with Cosmic Spell, it instead emits the following effects:

items: {@b {@i Gravity Pull (Void).}} A rift in space appears at the landing point of your spell and emits a strong pulling effect. Choose a creature affected by your spell, they must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, they take force damage equal to half of your sorcerer level (rounded up) and are restrained until the start of your next turn.

{@b {@i Spatial Pull (Spectrum).}} Two rifts in space form and are linked with one another. You can choose either one creature affected by your spell or yourself and then an empty space within 30 feet of your spell's location, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they are teleported to the point of your choosing. A creature can willingly fail this save.

subclassFeature.name: Blackhole (Void)
entries: {@i 6th-level Cosmic Soul feature}
You can instead use your Charisma modifier when making a roll that makes use of your Strength modifier.
In addition, you are considered Large sized for the purposes of grappling, shoving, and similar effects. You are considered Huge at level 14 and Gargantuan at level 18.

subclassFeature.name: Wormhole (Spectrum)
entries: {@i 6th-level Cosmic Soul feature}

You learn the {@spell misty step} spell. It counts as a sorcerer spell for you and you can cast at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, if you do expend a spell slot to cast the spell, you can surround yourself with the essence of the various cosmos along the way, exploding either at your previous location or where you teleported to. Creatures adjacent to you take 2d6 damage of any type of your choosing other than slashing, piercing, bludgeoning, or force. The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

subclassFeature.name: Mastery of the Void (Void)
entries: {@i 14th-level Cosmic Soul feature}

Your gravitational pull is strengthened even further. You no longer need any free hands for grappling and your reach for both grappling and shoving is increased to 10 feet. You can have up to 3 creatures grappled at a time. Additionally, whenever you can an action to initiate a shove or grapple to any number of creatures within your range.
As a bonus action, you can cause all creatures grappled by you to take 2d6 force damage and pulled 15 feet towards you.

subclassFeature.name: Mastery of the Spectrum (Spectrum)
entries: {@i 14th-level Cosmic Soul feature}

Your control over cosmic portals is strengthened even further. Once per long rest, you can open a two-way portal within an area you can see as an action. This rift is Large in size and can be directed to a random location of the Cosmos of your choosing.

items: {@b {@i Mendayn Cosmos.}} You can freely choose the landing point of this portal as long as it is a location that you can name or accurately envision.

{@b {@i Elemes Giga-Cosmos.}} Choose from one of the four elements that make up the Elemes Giga-Cosmos: air, earth, fire, and water. At the end of your turn, the effects of a Devastation Orb of the chosen element occurs within 45 feet of the portal. You can freely change the current active element as a bonus action.

{@b {@i Fey Cosmos.}} Whenever a spell is casted from within or into 45 feet of the portal, the caster must make a d20 roll. On a roll of 1 to 5, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect. If a Wild Magic effect is a spell, it's too wild to be affected by Metamagic. If it normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.
{@b {@i Fell Cosmos.}} Whenever a spell is casted from within or into 45 feet of the portal, the caster must make a d20 roll. On a roll of 1 to 5, the spell does not activate.
{@b {@i Selas Cosmos.}} A healing surge is emitted at the end of your turn. All creatures within 45 feet of the portal regains hit points equal to your character level.
