{@b {@i Helas Cosmos.}} A surge of death and decay is emitted at the end of your turn. All creatures within 45 feet of the portal takes necrotic damage equal to your character level.

entries: You may only have one two-way portal open at a time. This rift in space can be closed if dispelled, or if your concentration for it is broken. Otherwise, it automatically closes after a minute.

subclassFeature.name: Center of Ruination (Void)
entries: {@i 18th-level Cosmic Soul feature}

Your very touch is capable of shredding apart beyond the fabric of reality. When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can spend up to 3 sorcery points to determine the gravity of your attack. Choose one (two if the attack was a critical hit) of the following effects:

items: Per sorcery point spent, the damage dealt is amplified by 2d8 force damage and permanently reduces the target's AC by 1.
Per sorcery point spent, the target's speed is reduced 5 feet and all saving throws they make is reduced by 1.
Per sorcery point spent, the target reduces the amount of spell slots that they have, starting from the lowest level slots.

subclassFeature.name: Center of Genesis (Spectrum)
entries: {@i 18th-level Cosmic Soul feature}

You become capable of embodying the cosmos themselves. As an action, choose one of the cosmic rifts other than the Mendayn Cosmos from the Mastery of the Spectrum class feature to become an avatar of that cosmic space by spending 3 sorcery points. You gain the following effects:

items: You gain a flying speed equal to double your walking speed.
Any attacks made against you are rolled with disadvantage and all saving throws that you make are rolled with advantage.
The range of the portal's effects is reduced to 15 feet and you become the center point of the cosmic rift. Additionally, you can choose to be immune to the effects of the portal.
This transformation overrides the one portal limit of the Mastery of the Spectrum feature, allowing you to take on this form and have a cosmic rift open at the same time.

entries: At the beginning of your turn, you must expend 3 sorcery points, being unable to do so ends this transformation. You may only take on this transformation once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Ancient Dragon
entries: Your patron is an ancient dragon that has wandered the realm for more than a millennia. The details of the arrangement varies widely - a metallic dragon may have made the pact to create a force of good or save a life, a chromatic dragon may have made their pact with you in exchange for service... or part of some manipulative plan that the minds of lesser mortals would struggle to comprehend. Most often these bonds are granted by ancient dragons steeped in immense power and knowledge.

entries.subclassFeature: Draconic Blast, A Dragon's Roar|Warlock||Ancient Dragon|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Ancient Dragon lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Ancient Dragon Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell dragon's breath|xge}, {@spell nathair's mischief|ftd}, {@spell rime's binding ice|ftd}
{@spell fire shield}, {@spell leomund's secret chest}, {@spell raulothim's psychic lance|ftd}
{@spell legend lore}, {@spell control winds|xge}, {@spell summon draconic spirit|ftd}

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Blast, A Dragon's Roar
entries: You gain the ability to unleash blasts of primal draconic energy from your hand or maw. As an action, you can unleash this power in a 15 foot cone or a 30 foot long, 5 foot wide line.

Features that apply to breath weapons also apply to Draconic Blast. Invocations that apply to eldritch blast also apply to Draconic Blast, though has a special interaction to the following invocations:

items: {@optfeature Eldritch spear} has a special interaction making it a 30 foot cone or 60 foot long, 5 foot wide line (you choose when unleash the blast).
{@optfeature Fatal blast|ASS} which instead lowers the DC by 3 and increases the damage bonus by 5.
{@optfeature Hyperactive discharge|ASS} allows you to unleash your blast twice as an action instead of its normal effect.
{@optfeature Eldritch ravager|ASS}, which has an increased range of 30 feet and causes the blast to always be empowered.

entries: When you gain this feature, select one damage type of acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Creatures in the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw, or take {@dice 1d10} damage of the selected type. This feature's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level in warlock ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

When you use this ability, you can expend a pact magic spell slot to empower the draconic blast, dealing {@dice 1d10} additional damage per level of the pact magic slot expended. When empowered, it deals half damage even against creatures that pass their saving throw against it.

subclassFeature.name: Unparalleled Pride, A Dragon's Majesty
entries: {@i 6th-level Ancient Dragon feature}

You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws caused by lair actions and if an a lair action requires an attack roll to be made against you, it has disadvantage.
At 14th level, if you fail a saving throw, you can choose to have the resulting roll made for it to be a 15. You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Boundless Greed, A Dragon's Hoard
entries: {@i 10th-level Ancient Dragon feature}

You gain 1 temporary hit point for every 100 gold pieces in your possession (whether it be inside of your pockets, backpacks, or extradimensional spaces you have direct access to as you sleep) up to a maximum of your warlock level. You also gain an additional 1 temporary hit point for every magical item (not counting potions) in your possession and 3 temporary hit points for every magical attuned to you.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Form, A Mortal's Ascension
entries: {@i 14th-level Ancient Dragon feature}
You gain a few traits reminiscent of your patron. This includes the following:

items: Your Strength score becomes equal to your Charisma score.
Your hit point maximum increases by a number equal to your warlock level and while not wearing armor, your AC equals 14 + your Constitution modifier.
You cannot be frightened by effects at a lower level than yours and you can only be frightened by the same effect once every 24 hours.
A pair of wings that give you a flying speed of 40 feet.

A whole slew of natural weapons such as horns, fangs, a tail, and claws that deal 1d10 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice) on hit. Invocations that apply to pact weapons also apply to these natural weapons but does not require to be created nor stored.
The damage of your Draconic Blasts increases by 1d10.
As an action, you can increase your size to Large. Being enlarged this way gives you advantage on Strength and Constitution ability checks and saving throws.

entries.subclassFeature: Unparalleled Pride, A Dragon's Majesty|Warlock||Ancient Dragon|ASS|14

subclassFeature.name: Unparalleled Pride, A Dragon's Majesty
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to have the resulting roll made for it to be a 15. You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Sidus Dominae
entries: Your patron is one of the Sidera Dominiae, a constellation of dominion, higher beings who rival or even more commonly, surpass the power of deities within the seven stars. These beings are often enigmatic, their motives and ideologies vary greatly from one another and the only similarities that they all share is the path that they walked in order to command their cosmic potential.

The Sidera Dominiae themselves do not see their ilk to be cut from the same silk. There are some that seclude themselves, some that refuse any sort of fealty from their others, some that see the other constellations as mere rivals, others as egregious foes, and there are some that either does not seem to bat an eye to the ones with similar forces, or simply are just not aware of them.

The {@link Sidera Dominiae|https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=EDA457CEC009254F%21512&page=Edit&wd=target%28Warlock%20Patrons.one%7Caaf47b87-a2f6-4439-b900-8db97561575a%2F%29&wdorigin=717} and their most common title are among the following:

items: Araqiel, Cosmic Jury
Arya Heffenelauf, The Laughing Mad
Domitia, Divine Irony
Eleanor Poe, Mistress of Ravens
Fulgur, Lord of Thunder
Grimsley, The Sad Hatter
Herdunur, Last of a Legion
Inferno, The Lantern King
Jonah, Heaven's Redeemer
Kazdel, Tempus Anomalia
Miss Demeanor, The Red Deep
Naros, Warrior of the Shifting Sands
Nihil, Vantadark
Noah, Lord of Shadows
Reverend Floyd, Steel Sabbath
Shodoryu, Ink-bound Dragon
Slave to the Stars
The Cradle of Woe
The Merchant
Tlefana, The Dark Wisp
Wolfgang, Familiar Unbound

entries.subclassFeature: Sidus Dominae Expanded Spell List|Warlock||Sidus Dominae|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Sidus Dominae Expanded Spell List
entries: The Sidus Dominae lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. These spells can be found in the respective patron's page.

subclassFeature.name: Charted Constellations
entries: You've been given a star chart as part of your pact to the Sidera Dominiae. It is a Tiny object and can serve as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells. You determine its form by rolling on the Star Map table or by choosing one.
While holding this chart, you have these benefits:

items: You know the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip.
You have the {@spell misty step} spell prepared. It counts as a warlock spell for you, and is excluded in the number in the Spells Known column of the Warlock table.

You can cast {@spell misty step} without expending a spell slot but only if the area that you are teleporting to has an unobstructed view of the stars. You can do so a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stellar Motes
entries: {@i 6th-level Sidus Dominae feature}

You can conjure motes of starlight to fuel your spells. As an action, you can create a number of lights to orbit around yourself. The lights can be any color you wish and you can create an amount equal to your invocations known that last until you finish a long rest.

When you cast a warlock spell, you can expend a number of these stars equal to the spell's level instead of expending a spell slot. If you cast the spell at a higher level, you must expend an additional star for every level higher than its lowest level. You cannot cast the spell at a higher level than the current level of your warlock spell slots.

While you have at least one light remaining, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Once you conjure the stars, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Above The Skies
entries: {@i 10th-level Sidus Dominae feature}

The star chart given to you glimmers an even more incandescent light as it shows pathways previously never seen within it. You know the {@spell wind walk} spell and you can cast the spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Casting the spell this way would only benefit yourself but reverting to either form requires only an action within the first hour of its duration.

subclassFeature.name: God Shattering Star
entries: {@i 14th-level Sidus Dominae feature}

An essence of the found shard of divinity, although miniscule, has permeated through the depths of your soul. The slot level of your warlock spell slots increase to 7th level, increasing again to 8th at level 15, and 9th at level 17. You cannot learn warlock spells of 6th level or higher this way.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Eldritch Intervention|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Chained Virtue|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Eldritch Intervention
entries: Your will is now intertwined with Araqiel, the Cosmic Jury. Be the voice that announces the verdict. Be the gavel that strikes down judgement. Be the law, unbending.

Make a melee spell attack as an action to a creature within 30 feet of you. On a successful hit, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw or else be bound for judgement for 10 minutes, until the creature breaks free from its effects, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell).
While bound, the creature is under the following effects:

items: The target's location is always known and their speed is set to 0.
You and the target can telepathically speak to one another.
Any disguises or shapeshifting that the target has ongoing is undone while bound.
If the target is concentrating on any effects such as a spell or a feature, their concentration is broken.
The target is under the effects of the {@spell zone of truth} spell, and the {@spell tongues} spell.
If the target is a humanoid, they are under the effects of the {@spell hold person} spell.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target and they are immune to its effects for another 168 hours, reduced by a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus multiplied by 24.
When the effects of this feature ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Chained Virtue lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Chained Virtue Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell mordenkainen's private sanctum}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Ironclad Virtues
entries: A bailiff needs only be inscrutable and unwavering in the name of the law.
You gain proficiency with medium armor, heavy armor, and shields. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

subclassFeature.name: One-sided Binding
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Chained Virtue feature}
To learn the truth and an account with no bias, an interrogator must pave a way within anguish.
You gain resistance to all damage when you have a creature bound for judgement. Additionally, if the bound creature deals damage to you, it is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.
On the start of your turn, you can deal bludgeoning damage equal to your warlock level to the bound creature.

subclassFeature.name: Masks of Jurisdiction
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Chained Virtue feature}
The jurors don masks enigmatic but empathetic.

You learn the {@spell aid} spell and you can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Casting the spell this way gives the {@spell shield of faith} spell effect to the ones targeted for the spell until the end of its duration.

subclassFeature.name: Guilt-ridden Tenets
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Chained Virtue feature}
As judge, one must only display refusal to abjure an unwavering faith to the law and what makes right.

As a reaction to being damaged by a creature within 30 feet of you, you can impose a Wisdom saving throw on them to be bound for judgement as per the patron gift. If the target is successfully bound, their action is negated.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Erudition of Elation Exudes Exhilaration|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Feyland Comic|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Erudition of Elation Exudes Exhilaration
entries: To the Laughing Mad, there is none more joyous than to regale oneself within the chaos of simply the reality that is, and would be.
As a bonus action, you can stir the chaos within the Feylands with just the tip of your fingers. Roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect.

If a Wild Magic effect is a spell, it's too wild to be affected by Metamagic. If it normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.
You have a number of uses for this feature equal to your Charisma modifier and you regain all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Feyland Comic lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Seethe
entries: It is not the arcane of the fey, nor the power of divinity, that is the Feyland Comic's favored weapon, rather it is a cutthroat wit and a colorful whimsy. You learn the {@spell druidcraft} and the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrips. The base damage dice for it increases to d8s and invocations that apply to eldritch blast also apply to vicious mockery.

subclassFeature.name: Slapstick
entries: A laugh at the expense of others is joy to be found and to be earned. When a creature that you can see fails a saving throw, roll a percentile dice on the start of your next turn. On a 5 or lower, you regain a warlock spell slot. This percentage increases to 10% at 6th level, 15% at 10th level, and 20% at 14th level.
You make this roll only once per round.

subclassFeature.name: So Mad... So Bad...
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Feyland Comic feature}

Irritation caused by aggravation can only fuel fires, not blow a cold wind onto it. Take advantage of it. Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against a creature other than you while they are affected by your vicious mockery, they must make another saving throw against vicious mockery with disadvantage. On a failure, the attack the target makes deals halved damage.

subclassFeature.name: Salted Wounds
entries: The downtrodden remain gloomy. All is well in the world if the fact were not changed. After a hostile creature fails a saving throw that you forced them to make, your spellcasting modifier is increased by 1 on the next effect that you evoke onto them.

subclassFeature.name: Saccharine Mockery
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Feyland Comic feature}

Even as the wolves leap towards your throat, you need only smirk. All is well in the world if the fact were not changed. During a hostile encounter, each successful cast of vicious mockery gives you a +1 bonus to your concentration saves until the end of combat. This bonus can reach up to a maximum number equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Shushed Remarks
entries: You've gained mastery on not only ridiculing others, but also shooting down their attempts to do the same to you. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.

When you cast a spell with a verbal component, you can make a Deception check to alter the chanting so that spellcasters or those magically-inclined recognize it to be a different spell of your choice instead. Additionally, your warlock spells counts as being 2 spell levels higher when it is targeted with counterspell.

subclassFeature.name: Seeds of Conflict Sow Discord
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Feyland Comic feature}

Though noble attempts it is to unite those now-separate, it is all futile. All is well in the world if the fact were not changed. When you cast a warlock spell, you can cast your vicious mockery right after as a reaction, targeting all creatures affected by the spell. Additionally, when you are being targeted by an effect that you can see, you can use your reaction to cast vicious mockery towards the creature targeting you.

subclassFeature.name: Sadism and Schadenfreude
entries: As an action, you can mark a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you for 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). You focus on them as the butt of your jokes. When they use an action, you can use your reaction to force a Charisma saving throw to disrupt them. The reaction you can take for a certain action are as following:

items: {@b {@i Attack.}} The target has disadvantage on all rolls they make for the action this includes skill checks for grapples and shoves, and damage rolls.

{@b {@i Cast a Spell.}} You halt their spell casting and hold onto the spell that they were about to cast. While the spell is held, you can cast it once without expending a spell slot. The creature has a 25% chance of taking the spell back when they attempt to cast it again.

{@b {@i Dash.}} The target falls on their knees and are restrained until the start of their next turn, if the target has made any movement prior taking the action, they are returned to their position at the start of their turn.
{@b {@i Disengage.}} All creatures that you can see and can reach the target immediately uses their reaction to make an opportunity attack, even if they are using a ranged weapon.
{@b {@i Dodge.}} The target has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls made against them have advantage until the start of their next turn.
{@b {@i Search.}} The target is blinded until the start of their next turn.
{@b {@i Ready.}} The target forgets their readied action.
{@b {@i Help.}} The aid they provide is invalid and you can push the target towards any direction of your choice up to 30 feet.
{@b {@i Use an Object.}} The target drops the held object and they cannot pick it up until the start of their next turn.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or by expending a warlock spell slot.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Hellborn Halo|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Fallen Angel|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Hellborn Halo
entries: It is nothing but a divine irony for all demons to bend their knees before an angel, and for an angel to extend an olive branch towards demons.
As a bonus action, you can manifest the will of the Overlord of Helas, Domitia for 1 minute or until you end it as an action.

While in this state, you manifest a thorny halo above your head akin to your patron. You regain your maximum hit points if you are missing any and your maximum hit points cannot be lowered while in this state. At the start of your turn, all creatures within 30 feet of you except for yourself regain hit points for every 5 hit points that you are missing. At the end of your turn, you can reduce your hit points up to a number equal to your character level + your Constitution modifier + your Charisma modifier.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Fallen Angel lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Repent with Kindness
entries: Heavy is the head...
For every 10 hit points that you are missing, creatures that regain hit points through your actions regain an additional hit point.

subclassFeature.name: Repay with Servitude
entries: ...that wears the crown.

You have proficiency on medium armor, and shields. Additionally, learn the Interception fighting style and can increase the mitigated damage up to your proficiency bonus at the cost of losing hit points by the same amount.

subclassFeature.name: Repent with Virtuousness
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Fallen Angel feature}
So I spread my cloak over you...

You learn the {@spell revivify} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot and without the need for its material components once every 168 hours and you suffer all prices of resurrection when reviving others in this manner. Additionally, any creature you revive suffer only 2 prices of resurrection.

subclassFeature.name: Repay with Compassion
entries: ...and covered your nakedness.

At the end of your turn, you can give yourself and creatures of your choosing with 30 feet a +1 bonus to all saving throws. You give an additional +1 bonus to creature that you are concentrating a spell on, that you have healed during your turn, or mitigated damage for using the Interception fighting style within the round. These bonuses last until the start of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Repay with Kindness
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Fallen Angel feature}
Let love be without dissimulation...

The bonus healing that you give from the Repent with Kindness class feature is now increased by every 7 hit points. Additionally, creatures you heal have a 10% chance to gain the benefits of the lesser restoration spell. This percentage is increased proportionally to your bonus healing from the same feature.

subclassFeature.name: Repent with Servitude
entries: ...Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.
You can cast the {@spell detect evil and good} spell at will but can only find celestial and fiend creatures when done so.

All damage you take is halved if the source of it is celestial or fiend. You can use an action to attempt to learn the true name of a celestial or a fiend if they are adjacent to you and exist in the same plane. Roll a Charisma check against a DC of 10 + the target's challenge rating. The DC is also changed depending on the circumstances. On a successful attempt, you learn the creature's true name. On a failure, you may not be able to repeat this action on the same creature until the next dawn.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Thorns and Brimstone
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Fallen Angel feature}
And here is where all men, women, and children stand... Together.

You learn the {@spell aura of vitality} spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot and without the need for its material components once every long rest. When cast in this manner, the spell has the following traits:

items: The spell's healing die is increased to a 6d4.
You do not need to make Constitution saving throws to maintain your concentration on the spell when you take damage.

You extend the reach of the Interception fighting style within the aura. You can opt to not use up your reaction when taking this action. In doing so, you lose hit points equal to the total amount of damage mitigated by the action.
You can instead target two creatures within the aura when healing using this spell.
When a creature within the aura is knocked unconscious due to being at 0 hit points or lower, you can use a reaction to heal them using this spell.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Bleak Providence|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Macabre Poet|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Bleak Providence
entries: You are given a pact weapon known as {@item Nevermore|ASS}. It follows all of the standard rules of the Pact of the Blade feature except for the forms that it can be manifested as is limited to only daggers. You can only transform magic weapons into the pact weapon if they are of the forementioned type.

If you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, the benefits of this pact weapon extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, as long as it is a one-handed melee weapon with the light property.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Macabre Poet lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Macabre Poet Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell silvery barbs|SCC}, {@spell speak with animals}, {@spell wrathful smite}
{@spell rope trick}, {@spell wither and bloom|EGW}, {@spell branding smite}

subclassFeature.name: Purloined Luck
entries: A fate changed is a future bleak. To fear is fair, as to be mortal is to be weak.

When you finish a long rest, roll a number of d6s equal to your proficiency bonus and record the numbers rolled. You can expend any of the results onto any d20 or lower rolls that you make to give a bonus equal to such. The creature can wait until after it rolls before deciding to add any Purloined Luck, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. You can only apply one instance of Purloined Luck per roll.

subclassFeature.name: The Philosophy of Composition
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Fallen Angel feature}
A child can only but borrow from bookshelves surcease of sorrows. For if a child steals, it is their parents send instead to the gallows.

As an action, you can create one nonmagical item of your choice in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. The item must appear on a surface or in a liquid that can support it. The gp value of the item can't be more than 20 times your warlock level, and the item must be Medium or smaller. The created item disappears after a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus.
The size of the item you can create with this feature increases by one size category when you reach 10th level (Large) and 14th level (Huge).

subclassFeature.name: Into The Maelstrom
entries: A dirge of hope that melancholy burden bore.
When you cast a Smite spell, you hold its concentration separately.

subclassFeature.name: Murders In The Morgue
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Fallen Angel feature}
By angels hath sent thee, respite and nepenthe.
You learn any two languages of your choice. Additionally, you immediately identify and recognize the languages being used when you hear and read them.

As a reaction to killing a creature, you can revert back to a more pristine state as though you were never there and your innocence still proven true. Your clothes and your body are cleansed of any stains and you gain the benefits of a long rest. You can only use this feature once per week.

subclassFeature.name: The Pit And The Pendulum
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Fallen Angel feature}
And my soul from out that shadow that lies floating on the floor... Shall be lifted, nevermore.
Whenever you make a d20 roll that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a resulting roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Sovereign of Storms

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Angered Clouds Discharge Coruscation|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Sovereign of Storms|ASS|1
Expanded Spell List|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Sovereign of Storms|ASS|1
Gauntlets Of Lightning|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Sovereign of Storms|ASS|1
Cloaked In Lightning|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Sovereign of Storms|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Angered Clouds Discharge Coruscation
entries: When you take an accumulated amount of damage equal or greater than your character level during the round, you gain the following benefits on your turn:

Your speed is increased by 10 multiplied by your proficiency bonus. This effect is doubled if you have taken lightning damage before your turn or if you are outdoors in stormy conditions. This speed can only be used for making high jumps.
You do not suffer the effects of high altitude environments and you only take halved bludgeoning damage if it is caused by falling. You are also not knocked prone due to taking fall damage.
When you make a high jump, the only limit imposed for its height is your available speed.

After falling, creatures in a certain range take lightning damage equal to the bludgeoning damage you would have taken before any reductions or resistances. This range starts at a 5-foot radius around you and increased by another 5 feet for every 30 feet that you fall.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Sovereign of Storms lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Gauntlets Of Lightning
entries: The Sovereign of Storms grant you a boon, one a part of his armory, the very palms on your hands emit pure energies of lightning arcing all around.
When you cast a spell with a warlock spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with lightning damage. Additionally, you learn the {@spell gust|xge} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Cloaked In Lightning
entries: The Sovereign of Storms grant you a boon, one a part of his armory, a body that can withstand an explosive royal soul.

You have proficiency in medium armor and heavy armor. Your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class. Additionally, your speed increases by 10 feet and by another 10 feet at 6th level, 10th level, and 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Never A Step Backwards
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Sovereign of Storms feature}
Though an ascension arduous, one must never falter no matter how high a mountain one scales.
For every 10 hit points that you are missing, your speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.subclassFeature: Determination through Defibrillation|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Sovereign of Storms|ASS|6

subclassFeature.name: Determination through Defibrillation
entries: Though an ascension arduous, one must always rise after a misplaced step.

When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, keep track of how much lightning damage you take until the first failed death saving throw you make. You can regain hit points equal to the number after a failed death saving throw on your turn.
You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Falling Thunder
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Sovereign of Storms feature}
Mortal men are cast from the very same die yet not all are equal. The one aspect that separates one from the rest is initiative.

When you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, you can magically teleport above one of the targeted creatures up to a vertical height of your casted spell's maximum range (e.g: casting the lightning bolt spell can teleport you up to 100 feet above an affected creature).
You can use this feature three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rising Lightning
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Sovereign of Storms feature}
You can only rise if you ride like lightning. Fear not the crash.
As a bonus action, you can magically teleport yourself and any creatures that you are grappling up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.
As a reaction, you can reduce your rate of descent to 0 until the start of your next turn.

You can use these features a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once), with both of them sharing the same resource. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest or if you expend a spell slot to gain a number of uses equal to the spell slot used.

entries.subclassFeature: Splendor Booming Throughout The Storm|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Sovereign of Storms|ASS|14

subclassFeature.name: Splendor Booming Throughout The Storm
entries: Under the weight of the world, under the weight of the fury of nature itself, ensure that it is yourself domineering over all tribulations. With a head held high and a stature unfurled, to be mortal is to be great.

As an action, you can clasp your hands together to create a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 1 mile away. Dark clouds begin to gather overhead and a thunderous storm precipitates all those surrounding. You gain temporary hit points equal to your normal walking speed. While you retain these temporary hit points, you have the following benefits:

items: You gain the benefits of The Sovereign of Storms' Patron Gift.

For every 5 feet that you move on a hard surface or in a liquid, your temporary hit points are reduced by 2 and hostile creatures within 15 feet of you take lightning damage equal to your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.
You have advantage on Athletics (Strength) checks.
You are considered one size larger for the purposes of grappling, and shoving.
You no longer move at half speed when grappling a target of the same size or smaller as you.
You can use this feature once every week.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Comfort within Gloom

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Sharing An Umbrella|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Comfort within Gloom|ASS|1
Expanded Spell List|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Comfort within Gloom|ASS|1
Downpour for the Downtrodden|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Comfort within Gloom|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Sharing An Umbrella
entries: You are given a pact weapon known as {@item The Pauper's Parasol|ASS}. It follows all of the standard rules of the Pact of the Blade feature except for the forms that it can be manifested as is limited to only longswords, spears, and warhammers. You can only transform magic weapons into the pact weapon if they are of the forementioned type.

If you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, the benefits of this pact weapon extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, as long as it is a melee weapon with the versatile property.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Comfort within Gloom lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Woeful Waters
entries: To be always found under the rain is no coincidence. Perhaps, for the Weeping Pauper, it is he who finds comfort under the weeping clouds. Perhaps, it is he who longs and ushers its convoy.
When you cast a spell with a warlock spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with acid or cold damage. Additionally, you learn the {@spell shape water|xge} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Downpour for the Downtrodden
entries: Within each droplet is a tear of gloom. Even under the sun where the clouds are bright and sunny, they yet cry under clouds murky.

As an action, you can call upon gloomy overcast on an area up to 60 feet of you for 3 rounds. The area of effect for this downpour begins with a 15-foot radius, increasing by 5 feet for every two levels the effect is cast with. At the start of the downpour's initiative (20), all creatures inside the area must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d6 acid damage, halved on a success. The damage dice for this feature increases by an additional 2d6 for every two levels the effect is cast with.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or by expending a warlock spell slot. Using this feature without expending a warlock spell slot follows the same spell slot level as your warlock spell slot or your highest mystic arcanum level, if you have any.

subclassFeature.name: Monsoon Dew
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Comfort within Gloom feature}
Is it the pain that manifests the defensive nature? Or is it the defensive nature that manifests the pain? Only one can truly know the answer to such.

As a bonus action, you can manifest a protective bubble on a creature within 30 feet of you. While this bubble is on a creature, they gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. This bubble bursts after 1 minute or the creature loses the temporary hit points gained from this feature. After the bubble bursts, the creature that the protective bubble is on regains hit points equal to your warlock level.
You have a number of uses for this feature equal to your Charisma modifier and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Slow Jams
entries: Wretched sorrow leads to weeping knees buckled until a dry tomorrow.

When a creature fails its save against the downpour, you can use your reaction to subject them to a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their turn. You can target a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier when taking this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Pitied Inequity
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Comfort within Gloom feature}
No matter who, no matter what, we all grieve differently. To live is loss. To err is mortal, the forgive is divine.

When a creature fails its save against the downpour, you can use your reaction to extend a helping hand towards them. The creature is unaffected by the downpour, and for every creature safeguarded that is hostile towards you, you have a 10% chance to regain your use for downpour for the downtrodden. You can target a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier when taking this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Moody Blues
entries: Where there is comfort in gloom, there is comfort within the silence.

When casting the downpour, you can expend one of your warlock spell slots to imbue it with a quelling effect. Doing so causes the downpour to act as a sphere of silence, as per the {@spell silence} spell.

Additionally, the downpour has an additional effect even when cast normally: When a creature fails its save against the downpour and takes damage from it, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it has to make.

subclassFeature.name: Watching The Downpour Behind A Window
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Comfort within Gloom feature}
Retrospect.
Your spirit can become untethered from your physical form. As an action, you can project your spirit from your body. The body you leave behind is unconscious and in a state of suspended animation.

Your spirit resembles your mortal form in almost every way, replicating your game statistics but not your possessions. Any damage or other effects that apply to your spirit or physical body affects the other. Your spirit can remain outside your body for up to 4 hours or until your concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). When your projection ends, your spirit returns to your body or your body magically teleports to your spirit's space (your choice).
While projecting your spirit, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your spirit and body gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. You can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, but you take 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside a creature or an object.
You make skill checks using your Charisma modifier with advantage and your proficiency bonus is doubled for those skills.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Greed is Good|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Primeval Greed|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Greed is Good
entries: The King of Greed is, through and through, a dragon more draconic than most. It is to be expected that he remains ever-so-wise in the dealings of the arcane. It is to be expected that he remains ever-so-wanting of treasures of the trove.

As an action, you can expend your wealth to improve your own or others' capabilities. A creature can be affected by this feature multiple times, as long as it does not already have the benefit to be given. When choosing which benefit to give to a creature, refer to potions (up to Rare rarity) for an effect and its price.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Primeval Greed lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Primeval Greed Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell gift of gab|AI}, {@spell jim's glowing coin|AI}
{@spell meld into stone}, {@spell wall of sand|XGE}, {@spell wall of water|XGE}, {@spell wind wall}
{@spell stone shape}, {@spell conjure minor elementals}, {@spell wall of fire}

subclassFeature.name: Howlings of Herdunur
entries: A great dragon whose domain is the earths both below and above and the middling, has given you but a modicum of his strength. Be grateful.

When you cast a spell with a warlock spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice). Additionally, you learn the {@spell mold earth} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: All That Glitters
entries: ...is gold. Gold, though but a rock shiny, its glamour is power through and through. No matter what, when, and where it is found, greed arises.

You can use currency as a spellcasting focus and you do not require having the material components for a spell if you have enough currency + 25% of its cost to fund it. Your currency is expended if the spell consumes the material component for its casting.

subclassFeature.name: Generational Wealth
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Primeval Greed feature}
Gifts from beyond, need not always be incomprehensible. There is only value within which is real.
Whenever you find a bounty of wealth, the total value of it is increased by up to 25%.

entries.subclassFeature: Keen Eyes Earth Dragon|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Primeval Greed|ASS|6

subclassFeature.name: Keen Eyes Earth Dragon
entries: The eyes of a dragon sees not only the ley lines of magic, but so too does it see history itself in its eons of wisdom.

You gain proficiency in Thieves' Tools and Sleight of Hand. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for checks using these skills. Additionally, you instinctively know how much money is in a pile and you learn the monetary value of an item when you hold it.
You also have advantage on Charisma checks whenever you attempt to barter, haggle, or generally negotiate when buying or selling.

subclassFeature.name: Regorge, Reuse, Recycle
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Primeval Greed feature}

After drinking a potion and it taking effect, you can store it within your body for 24 hours. While stored, you can gain the benefits of the potion as a bonus action, expending the stored effect. When drinking a potion and you already have a stored effect that is different from it, you can choose which effect to store.
Additionally, you are immune to the poisoned condition and have immunity to poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Domains and Dragons
entries: As an action, you can howl an echo of the Primeval Greed's roar. If you do, you can pay up to gp equal to your warlock level multiplied by 500. Every creature within 30 feet, including yourself, is subjected on of two effects, you can choose which effect occurs on each individual creature:

items: For every 500 gp spent, you deal 5 primordial bludgeoning damage to a creature. If the gp spent is equal to or greater than 5000 gp, the creature is knocked prone. If the gp spent is equal to or greater than 9000 gp, the damage dealt is doubled.

For every 500 gp spent, the creature regains 3 hit points. If the gp spent is equal to or greater than 5000 gp, the creature rolls its next saving throw with advantage. If the gp spent is equal to or greater than 9000 gp, the creature is affected by the lesser restoration spell.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or by expending a warlock spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Walking Treasure Hoard
entries: Slumbering, stirring, wakened, ascendant. Nay. You are but mortal. A mortal with inhibitions loosened by ambition.
You do not require to attune to magic items of common and uncommon rarity to gain their benefits or use them.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Fuel for the Pyre|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Kindling Torch|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Fuel for the Pyre
entries: You learn a ritual to convert vials of oil into Fuel for the Pyre. Over the course of an hour, you convert a number of pints equal to your Charisma modifier. This blessing lasts for 8 hours.
When a creature is doused with this oil, it takes 10 fire damage, instead of 5 when dealt fire damage and all fire damage it takes is considered to be primal.
When spread on the ground, the area it occupies burns for 1 minute and creatures that occupy the space but is not larger must use an action to escape.

You have proficiency with attacks made with a vial of oil and you add your proficiency bonus when determining the DC for vials of oil. You can take the Use an Object action as a bonus action when using vials of oil.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Kindling Torch lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Torched Brimstone
entries: With a touch, a fume... Howlings of the damned ablaze... Torched brimstone singes all...
As an action, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by anyone else and set it on fire.
When you cast a spell with a warlock spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with fire damage. Additionally, you learn the {@spell control flames|XGE} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Gathering Kindling
entries: A twig, a branch, coals... The lifeline for all that lives... Gathering kindling...

You learn the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. On a hit, creatures adjacent to the target is dealt fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier and invocations that apply to eldritch blast also apply to the cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Ash Seeketh Embers
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Kindling Torch feature}
Where there is flame... Thus arises the white ash... Ash seeketh embers...
As an action, you can light yourself ablaze for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action or you are doused. While engorged in flames, you have the following benefits:

items: You are under the effects of the flame blade spell, the spell level for it is equal to your warlock spell slot level. You do not need to hold concentration for it.
Your AC becomes 13 + your Charisma modifier. You also have resistance on fire damage.
You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
At the start of your turn, each creature within 15-feet of you takes fire damage equal to half your warlock level.

entries: You can use this feature three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Polygenetic Eruptions
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Kindling Torch feature}
What starts doth not stop... A match lit spreads to its neck... What starts doth not stop...

Once per long rest, you have an additional warlock spell slot that you can use solely for spells that deal fire damage. Using this feature to cast a spell adds your warlock level to the damage dice for the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Hellfire Incarnate
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Kindling Torch feature}
Kindling to embers... What flames nurture, flames taketh... Ashes to ashes...
When you are lit ablaze as per the ash seeketh embers class feature, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a flying speed equal to double your walking speed and moving doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
You become immune to fire damage and as a reaction to taking fire damage, you can regain hit points equal to half of the damage taken.
You are immune to the grappled, prone, and restrained conditions.

When you move within 5 feet of a creature or an object that isn't being worn or carried, it takes fire damage from your trail of heat equal to your warlock level. A creature or object can take this damage only once during a turn.
Being doused in water no longer ends this ablaze state.

entries: When you roll initiative and have no uses for ash seeketh embers, you regain 1 use for the class feature.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Pure Deliverance|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Divine Messenger|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Pure Deliverance
entries: You are given a pact weapon known as the {@item Banner of Beginnings|ASS}. It follows all of the standard rules of the Pact of the Blade feature except for the forms that it can be manifested as is limited to only quarterstaffs. You can only transform magic weapons into the pact weapon if they are of the forementioned type.

If you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, the benefits of this pact weapon extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, as long as it is a melee weapon with the versatile or two-handed property.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Divine Messenger lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Divine Messenger Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell aura of life}, {@spell aura of purity}

subclassFeature.name: Fostered Hope
entries: Neither darkness nor the horrors the lurk within it has ever brought down humanity.

Whenever you target a nonhostile creature with a beneficial effect (such as healing, buffing, and et cetera), you gain a point of Fostered Hope. You can only gain one point of Fostered Hope per turn. When you reach the maximum amount of points, as an action, you can expend all of it to bolster a number of your allies within 30 feet of you up to your Charisma modifier. When bolstered, they can take a turn right after yours. For this turn, the chosen allies have their movement halved and can take only one Action, they also do not regain their reaction.
The maximum number of points you can have is 10, reduced to 9 at 6th level, 8 at 10th level, and 7 at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Duality of Mortals and Violence
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Divine Messenger feature}

There will always come a time when you need to be face-to-face with your opposition. No matter how lofty or how miserable a life can be, you will not know normalcy without changes, and changes will always bring normalcy afterwards.
You gain two special reactions that you can use during combat. These reactions use the same resource and are detailed as such:

items: {@b {@i Peace.}} Whenever a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is about to make a saving throw, or a healing roll, you can use your reaction to roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the total.
{@b {@i War.}} Whenever a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is about to make an attack roll, or a damage roll, you can use your reaction to roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the total.

entries: You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you roll initiative and have no uses for this feature, you regain 1 use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Cometh Upon Cosmos
entries: The skies above that separate mortals from stars is nothing but space to be one day traversed.
When you use an ability or spell that allows you to magically teleport yourself or another creature, the maximum distance you can displace the target to is increased by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Unsullied Pigeons
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Divine Messenger feature}
Carried by the winds are words and sentiments exchanged no matter how far.

You learn the {@spell sending} spell. You can recast the spell on the same target without expending a spell slot up to a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. The timeframe for each recast must be under 1 hour or else you lose the benefit of this feature for that casting of the spell.
Once per long rest, you can cast the sending spell without expending a spell slot or material components.

subclassFeature.name: Beginnings, Transitions, and Time
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Divine Messenger feature}
The moments I have with you, even after I'm gone, even after how much time passes, is still a moment written in history.
At the beginning of a new day, you gain the benefits of a long rest. Additionally, you age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

subclassFeature.name: Divinity's Doorsteps
entries: Even if you and I forget, we'll always meet again in a paradise known as heaven. Goodbye...

You learn the {@spell dimension door} spell. Whenever you cast this spell, you can bring any number of willing creatures with you as long as they are adjacent to you while casting the spell. Additionally, the distance you can travel using this spell is increased to up to 1000 feet.
Once per long rest, you can cast the dimension door spell without expending a spell slot or material components.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Tools for Violence|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Red Deep|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Tools for Violence
entries: You are given a pact weapon known as {@item The Bleeding Drought|ASS}. It follows all of the standard rules of the Pact of the Blade feature except for the forms that it can be manifested as is limited to only tridents. You can only transform magic weapons into the pact weapon if they are of the forementioned type.
If you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, the benefits of this pact weapon extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, as long as it primarily deals piercing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodcurdling Anchor
entries: You can conduct a ritual of bloodletting as an action. This ritual can last up to 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). A blood-red ring of death manifests on the ground beneath you as a 15-foot radius circle as the ritual is ongoing.
The ritual's effects are the following:

items: Your speed is 0 and you cannot leave thew circle or else the ritual ends.

The only actions that you may take during your turn is an action to manifest the pact weapon and attack a creature with disadvantage or an action to continue the ritual. Continuing the ritual causes all impaled creatures to take all of your pact weapon's damage as bleed damage at the cost of you taking primal piercing damage equal to your character level + your proficiency bonus. If you do not take either of these actions, the ritual ends abruptly.

When a creature bleeds within the circle, you gain a charge that lasts until the start of your next turn. You lose a charge when an attack roll is made against you or you have to roll a saving throw, when a charge is consumed the attack roll is made with disadvantage or the saving throw that you have to make is with advantage.
You regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier when an impaled creature bleeds while in the circle. You only benefit from this once per round.

entries: You may use this feature once per short rest. You may also expend a Warlock spell slot to conduct the ritual.

subclassFeature.name: Sinner's Sails
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Red Deep feature}
As an action, you may manifest a steed made only of blood raring to graze. You take primal piercing damage equal to your character level when manifesting the steed.

This steed is a bicorn completely blood red with 2 horns on its head and will obey all of your commands. The bicorn uses the {@creature warhorse} stat block but instead has 1 hit point and also has a 60 feet swimming speed. It also dissipates when you conduct a ritual of bloodletting.
The bicorn gives you the following benefits while ridden:

items: If the bicorn moves at least 20 feet in a straight line before you make an attack, you have advantage on the attack roll.

When beginning a ritual of bloodletting, the bicorn enhances the effects of the ritual as it melds with it. All creatures within the circle takes all of your pact weapon's damage as bleed damage and must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save dc or be poisoned for the duration of the ritual.

entries: As a full-time action, you may manifest both steed and pact weapon at the same time and only take the prerequisite damage once for both of them.

subclassFeature.name: Casualties Come In Counts
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Red Deep feature}

When an impaled creature dies, all creatures within a 15-foot radius centered on it must make a Dexterity saving throw as the creature's corpse explodes into high-propulsion viscera conjoined by the Bleeding Drought. Creatures that fail to make the save takes all of your pact weapon's damage as bleed damage and primal piercing damage equal to the deceased creature's Constitution score, they are also impaled by the Bleeding Drought.
Additionally, you may bypass the quantity restriction of a pact weapon, allowing you to have multiple at a time without previously manifested weapons disappearing.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy is the Sin of Killing
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Red Deep feature}
The bloodletting ritual for Bloodcurdling Anchor reaches its greatest heights. The ritual now has the following effects:

items: The bloodletting ritual for Bloodcurdling Achor now extends up to 30 feet.
All impaled creatures have their speed set to 0 while inside of the circle and you are impervious to any effects that force your movement or displace you while inside of the circle.
You are under the effects of the {@spell shield} spell while you have a defensive charge.
You also regain hit points equal to your character level when healing from the ritual. Additionally, you regain hit points again when an impaled creatures bleeds to death while inside of the circle.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Scarab Synesthesia|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Eternal Warrior|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Scarab Synesthesia
entries: The shifting sands are not what they seem, they are but fragments of Naros. Scarabs desiccated, their husks dried, the sands that shift are corpses of the insects of sunbreak.

You gain +1 to your AC, saving throws, and attack rolls. Whenever you regain hit points, you regain an additional amount equal to your proficiency bonus. These bonuses are doubled when you are standing on top of sand, the amount of sand underneath you must occupy at least a 15-feet radius circle around you.
As a reaction to being displaced, you can reduce the movement by 20 feet. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Scarab Infestation
entries: As you reach out your hand towards the opposition, scarabs swarm as they brought forth by a sandstorm. You learn the {@spell infestation|XGE} cantrip. You regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt by infestation and invocations that apply to eldritch blast also apply to the cantrip.

When casting the infestation cantrip, you can empower it a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and all uses of this feature is regained on a long rest. When empowered, your next melee attack on a target that fails the saving throw against infestation heals you for all the damage dealt by the attack instance. This feature only works on creatures that are Large size or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Rags of the Mummified
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Eternal Warrior feature}

Though the Scarab King seems spindly and thin, his flesh embalmed in rot, his rags grant him protection. Your hit point maximum increases by 6 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

entries.subclassFeature: Heart of the Deceased|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Eternal Warrior|ASS|6

subclassFeature.name: Heart of the Deceased
entries: As your affinity to the Eternal Warrior grows, so too will his granted companions. You can choose two from the following benefits for your empowered cantrip:

items: You gain more uses for the empowered cantrip equal to your proficiency bonuses.
Your empowered cantrip instead targets a 15-foot cone centered on your location.
Your empowered cantrip has an increased DC equal to your proficiency bonus.
Your empowered cantrip takes effect on creatures that are Huge size or smaller.

You regain hit points equal to all of the damage dealt by the empowered cantrip, instead of just half. If your empowered cantrip kills the target, you regain hit points equal to the creature's Constitution score.

subclassFeature.name: Still Sarcophagi
entries: As he has said, as long as the fight is not over, he remains standing.

When you are reduced to 0 hit points and even if the damage taken exceeds your maximum hit points, you are entombed into a sarcophagus. While in the sarcophagus, you still roll death saving throws on your turn and taking damage will give you failed death saving throws as normal. All damage taken by creatures within 30 feet of you is tallied. Once you are stabilized, you regain hit points equal to half of the tallied damage.
You regain use of this feature after one week.

subclassFeature.name: Desiccating Sands
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Eternal Warrior feature}
The scarab swarm surround every inch of your opposition's skin. They feed. You can choose from the following benefits for your empowered cantrip:

items: If a humanoid creature fails the saving throw against your empowered cantrip, they are paralyzed until the end of your next turn.

Your empowered cantrip automatically kills the target if their remaining hit points after the attack is lower than your warlock level + your Charisma score + your proficiency bonus or a percentage equal your warlock level + your Charisma score.
If a creature fails its saving throw against your empowered cantrip, it is levitated in the air up to 60 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.subclassFeature: Pyramid for the Fallen Scarabs|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Eternal Warrior|ASS|14

subclassFeature.name: Pyramid for the Fallen Scarabs
entries: The scarab swarm surround every inch of your skin. The more blood that you lose, the more that they can feed. For every 25% of your hit points missing, you gain +1 to your AC and attack rolls, and +2 to your damage rolls and hit points regained when healed.
As an action, you can reduce your hit points up to an amount lesser than your current hit points. You gain temporary hit points equal to half of the hit points reduced.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Exception to the Law|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Exception|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Exception to the Law
entries: To abide by Nihil's rule you must deny the laws of Normality. You are prohibited to use any magic as long as you are bound to its will. You are bound to these following effects:

items: You lose the Spellcasting and Pact Magic features for all of your classes and you are no longer able to cast spells through any method and you lose any spell slots that you may have.
You are also not allowed to use any magic items and you immediately end attunement to any that you are currently attuned to.
You cannot be healed through magical means.

You cannot be willingly under the effects of any spell, you must make a Constitution saving throw before being affected by a spell if there are no targeting clauses for them such as a willing target, a spell attack roll, or a saving throw to avoid its effects.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and breaking away from spell effects.
You have resistance to damage dealt by spells and the duration of spell effects are halved on you.
Spell attacks have disadvantage when rolled against you.

subclassFeature.name: Deny the Kindling
entries: The field of everdark touches your core. On a hit with a melee attack, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they lose their lowest-level available spell slot up to your warlock spell slot level.

subclassFeature.name: Deny the Impossible
entries: The field of everdark binds down the normalcy within the arcane. Your warlock spell slot level is now determined by your character level halved (rounded upwards) to a limit of 9th level spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Deny the Spark
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Exception feature}

The field of everdark envelops your core. When using the Deny the Kindling class feature, if the target's highest-level available spell slot is lower than your warlock spell slot level, they automatically fail the saving throw. Additionally, once per turn if the aforementioned condition is met, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Deny the Imperceptible
entries: The field of everdark breaks down the trickeries of the arcane. You are not affected by spells that produce magical darkness or spells that cause the blinded condition if the spell slot used to cast these spells are below your spell slot level. You can also see through illusion spells if the spell slot used to cast these spells are below your spell slot level.

subclassFeature.name: Deny the Ember
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Exception feature}

The field of everdark enraptures your core. You can 'cast' the {@spell interrupt incantation|ASS}, {@spell counterspell}, {@spell dispel magic} spells at will within a range of 30 feet. The spell level for these actions are equal to your warlock spell slot level increased by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Deny the Blaze
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Exception feature}
The field of everdark corrupts your core. You are immune to the effects of spells and magical effects that are below your spell slot level. The exceptions to this feature are very limited.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Midnight Stroll
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. After teleporting, adjacent creatures of your choice must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses on a long rest. The frighten effect can always take effect when you magically teleport.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Bogeyman lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Bogeyman Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell speak with dead}, {@spell speak with plants}

subclassFeature.name: Leaving No Stone Unturned
entries: Knowledge and secrets is the domain of the Lord of Shadows. You gain an additional eldritch invocation of your choice and additional one at 6th level, 10th level, and 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Gaze
entries: You gain the talent for instilling delusions of fear with just a single gaze. When taking the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with a Phantom Gaze on a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. When imposing a Phantom Gaze, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Can't Run From The Bogeyman
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Bogeyman feature}

When you start your turn while a creature is suffering the frightened condition caused by an effect that you made, your speed increases by 10 feet and you don't provoke opportunity attacks until the end of your turn. Additionally, you gain an additional reaction which can be used only to make an opportunity attack.

subclassFeature.name: Secrets To Be Shushed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to knowledge checks and you roll with advantage on knowledge checks that you can add your proficiency bonus to.

subclassFeature.name: Quaking In Your Boots
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Bogeyman feature}
Perspiration blinds your eyes and the beating of your own heart deafens your ears. When you cause the frightened condition on a creature, they are also blinded and deafened for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Noah's Dark
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Bogeyman feature}

You can become the very personification of terror itself. A primeval fear is the unknown, a darkness unfulfilled that covers every inch of your visage. As an action, you can take on the Looming Dread form for 1 minute. While under the Looming Dread form, you have an aura of true terror with a 300 foot radius that moves with you, centered on you and it has the following effects on creatures within the aura:

items: Additional effects from the frightened condition (such as Can't Run From The Bogeyman, Quaking In Your Boots, and et cetera) is no longer restricted to only creatures frightened by you.
You know the location of any frightened creature.
You can target frightened creatures within the aura with an attack or a spell.
After casting a spell while expending a spell slot, you can target creatures affected by the spell with a phantom gaze as part of the casting.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Inquisition of Iron

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Empyrean Prostophilia|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Inquisition of Iron|ASS|1
Expanded Spell List|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Inquisition of Iron|ASS|1
Heralding the Future|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Inquisition of Iron|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Empyrean Prostophilia
entries: You can conduct a ritual of self-transmutation over the course of 1 hour. You require enough space to carve a 10-foot radius circle of sigils underneath you and enough metal per pound for the limbs that is being replaced. The outcome of this ritual is a prosthetic limb made mainly of the metal provided for the ritual and basic metals to connect and allow it to function.

As an action, you can configurate one of your prosthetic limbs to become a portable hand-cannon. This hand-cannon counts a ranged martial weapon that you have proficiency in, it is counted as a firearm with a range of 50 feet and a long range of 150 feet but does not include the loading and ammunition properties. You use your choice of your Dexterity or Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls. The damage it deals on a hit depends on the metal that the prosthetic limb is made out of.
You can use any of your prosthetic limbs as a spellcasting focus.
Additionally, you gain proficiency on tinker's tools and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this tool proficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Inquisition of Iron lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Heralding the Future
entries: Progress and innovation need not the flames of conquest, rather just a spark of inspiration.
When you gain this feature, pick two artificer infusions to learn. You learn additional an infusion of your choice when you reach 6th level, 10th level, 14th level.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the artificer infusions you learned with a new one.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a nonmagical object and imbue it with one of your artificer infusions, turning it into a magic item. An infusion works on only certain kinds of objects, as specified in the infusion's description. If the item requires attunement, you can attune yourself to it the instant you infuse the item. If you decide to attune to the item later, you must do so using the normal process for attunement.

Your infusion remains in an item indefinitely, but when you die, the infusion vanishes after a number of days have passed equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 day). The infusion also vanishes if you give up your knowledge of the infusion for another one.

You can infuse more than one nonmagical object at the end of a long rest; the maximum number of objects appears in the Infused Items column of the Artificer table. You must touch each of the objects, and each of your infusions can be applied within the same item. If you try to exceed your maximum number of infusions, the oldest infusion immediately ends, and then the new infusion applies.
If an infusion ends on an item that contains other things, like a bag of holding, its contents harmlessly appear in and around its space.

subclassFeature.name: Overclock Switch
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Inquisition of Iron feature}
Use in moderation.

Once per long rest, whenever you roll damage dice or dice for regaining hit points, you can opt to instead gain the maximum result. You also add your warlock level to the result when using this feature.

entries.subclassFeature: Kin By Proxy|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Inquisition of Iron|ASS|6

subclassFeature.name: Kin By Proxy
entries: The flora and the fauna, they too are blessing by the gods, they too roam these hallowed lands. We share it with them.

You can cast the {@spell speak with animals} and the {@spell speak with plants} spells at will. Additionally, you know {@language Druidic}, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check but can't decipher it without magic.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Nanomachines
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Inquisition of Iron feature}
...Son.
As a reaction when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can dampen the incoming energy, halving the damage taken from the triggering damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Engineering Expertise
entries: My gift is not of power but of wit and wisdom. Such is but an opportunity extended.

When you undergo a downtime activity that involves conducting research, crafting, or modifying a device, magic item, or phenomena that is involved with robotics, constructs or metals, your progress with such is at doubled speed.

subclassFeature.name: One With Metal, Nature, and Heaven
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Inquisition of Iron feature}
Ideal.
You can cast the following spells once per long rest without expending a spell slot and material components:

items: {@spell guardian of faith}
{@spell guardian of nature|XGE}
{@spell commune with nature}

entries: While any of these spells are active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can reroll any dice that you roll once per die.
You gain a +2 bonus to your AC and your saving throws.
You have resistance to damage from spells.

Whenever you cast a warlock spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can cast it using your bonus action instead. In addition, you can make an attack using any of your weapons as a bonus action.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Black Ink Painting|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Lost Brush|ASS|1
Hatred Within The Mulberry|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Lost Brush|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Black Ink Painting
entries: You learn of the accursed ink arts that once bound Shodoryu, now tainted by his anger. Over the course of a long rest, you can write a cursed script of calligraphy onto magic items so that you have lordship over them. You can have a number of inked magic items equal to your Charisma modifier and inked items have the following effects:

items: You can use an inked item as a spellcasting focus for your spells.
You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use and attunement of magic items.
You can turn any magic weapon into a pact weapon as long as you are capable of doing so. This is treated as the special ritual of transforming a magic weapon into a pact weapon.
You can turn all damage dealt by an attack made with an inked weapon into force damage.
If the magic item can hold more than one charge, it gains an additional charge.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Lost Brush lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Lost Brush Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell evard's black tentacles}, {@spell leomund's secret chest}
{@spell steel wind strike|XGE}, {@spell summon draconic spirit|FTD}

subclassFeature.name: Hatred Within The Mulberry
entries: The Lost Brush tells tales of ancient cruelties. You gain two eldritch invocations of your choice, both of these invocations must have a Pact of the Blade prerequisite.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and calligrapher's supplies.

subclassFeature.name: Volitional Sealing
entries: The Ink-Bound Dragon has found wrath from solitude, might from wrath. As an action you can take on a Sealed Scripts state. Being in a sealed state lasts for 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). When entering a sealed state, you can choose to take on any number of curses to gain a point of Ire, which you can expend to gain bonuses of your choosing through Wrath. The effects of the curses from Ire and furies from Wrath lasts until the end of your sealed state.
