Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or by expending a warlock spell slot.

entries.caption: Ire
rows: Your maximum hit points is reduced by 10. You gain 1 Ire.
Your speed is reduced by 15. You gain 1 Ire.
Your attack bonus is reduced by 2. You gain 1 Ire.
Your armor class is reduced by 3. You gain 2 Ire.
Your Warlock spellcasting modifier is reduced by 1. You gain 2 Ire.

entries.caption: Wrath
rows: You can expend 1 Ire to increase your speed by 5.
You can expend 1 Ire to deal an extra 1 force damage to targets you damage.
You can expend 1 Ire to give yourself a +1 bonus to your attack rolls.
You can expend 1 Ire to give yourself a +1 bonus to a skill of your choice.
You can expend 2 Ire to give yourself a +1 bonus to a saving throw of your choice.
You can expend 2 Ire to increase your armor class by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Dragon's Descension
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Lost Brush feature}
Your critical hit threshold increases by 2.

entries.subclassFeature: More Fuel For The Pyre|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Lost Brush|ASS|6

subclassFeature.name: More Fuel For The Pyre
entries: The Lost Brush awakens more of the hexes and curses known throughout the Ink-Bound Dragon's lifetime. You learn the following curses of Ire, and furies of Wrath:

entries.caption: Ire
rows: You gain vulnerability to the main damage type of the next instance of damage you take. This curse can be taken multiple times and you gain 2 Ire for each damage type that you are vulnerable to from this cruse. When this curse is taken multiple times, you gain vulnerability from a damage instance if it has multiple damage types, if not, you gain vulnerability from the next damage instance if you are not already vulnerable to it.
You are poisoned. You gain 2 Ire and this curse can only be taken once.
You can only make a single attack when you take the Attack or Casting a Spell actions. You gain 2 Ire and this curse can only be taken once.
On your turns, you must choose whether you get a move, an action, or a bonus action; You only get one of the three. You gain 3 Ire and this curse can only be taken once.

entries.caption: Wrath
rows: You can expend 2 Ire to have a climbing and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can expend 3 Ire to gain the Mounted Combatant feat.
You can expend 3 Ire to be able to take the Hide action as a bonus action.
You can expend 4 Ire to have resistance to a damage type of your choice.
You can expend 4 Ire to no longer needing to expend a reaction to make an opportunity attack.

subclassFeature.name: Malevolent Outrage
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Lost Brush feature}

You have advantage on attack rolls on creatures that damaged you on the previous round. On a successful hit, you also deal half of the total damage that they dealt to you, once per creature per round.

subclassFeature.name: Folklore and History
entries: The Lost Brush swells with the mysticism of folklore and bygone dynasties. You learn the following curses of Ire, and furies of Wrath:

entries.caption: Ire
rows: At the start of your turn, you have a 10% chance of being stunned. You gain 2 Ire.
You gain 3 Ire and this curse can only be taken once.
Your maximum hit points is reduced by 50. You gain 7 Ire and this curse can only be taken once.

entries.caption: Wrath
rows: You can expend 5 Ire to increase all of your ability scores by 2, as does your maximum for those scores.
You can expend 5 Ire to quadruple your size and your weight multiplied by 64 as you become Huge. Your melee attacks knock the target prone on a hit if their size is Large or smaller.
You can expend 5 Ire to target yourself with the true polymorph spell. As an action, you can change the form that you are taking on.
You can expend 5 Ire to cast the whirlwind spell and you gain a flying speed equal to double your walking speed.
You can expend 5 Ire to be able to grant the effects of the animated objects spell on any object you touch.
You can expend 5 Ire to be able to cast the otiluke's freezing sphere spell centered on you, without expending a spell slot. You are immune to the effects of this spell.
You can expend 5 Ire to gain the effects of the greater invisibility spell.

subclassFeature.name: The Oppressed No Longer Bound
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Lost Brush feature}
For each cursed item that you are attuned to, your Charisma score and another ability score of your choice increases by 1, as does your maximum for those scores.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Starstruck
entries: At the beginning of your turn, a number of magic bolts equal to your proficiency bonus emerge from your wild, hardcore soul. Roll a 1d7 for each of the bolts which will represent their colors. All of the bolts deal astral force damage equal to your casting of Magic Missile would and they have the following effects depending on their color:

items: {@b {@i Red Reds.}} Your bolt carries the breath of Solstice causing its target to be more susceptible to negative magical effects. The next time that the target would take damage from a spell effect, it is converted to its astral damage counterpart.
{@b {@i Orange Oranges.}} Your bolt carries the breath of Velour causing its target's eyes to be clouded in dark shadows. The target is blinded until the end of their next turn.

{@b {@i Yellow Yellows.}} Your bolt carries the breath of Dhasa causing the target to be hoisted upwards into the air, with a weightlessness that cannot be compared. The target rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended there until the end of their next turn.

{@b {@i Green Greens.}} Your bolt, Saratola // A cloud of flames it becomes // Dragon's Flight, Listless. The bolt turns into a dragon's breath on impact, causing all targets in a 15-foot cone behind the target, opposite your direction to take its damage. You can also change its damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

{@b {@i Blue Blues.}} Your bolt carries the breath of Soyle causing its target to be pulled down into the depths, pushed by the weight of an endless ocean. The target is restrained until the end of their next turn.
{@b {@i Indigo Indigos.}} Your bolt carries the breath of Z. Nothing additional happens.

{@b {@i Violet Violets.}} Your bolt carries the breath of Rathos causing its target to be instilled with a resolve to overcome all challenges. The target regains hit points rather than being damaged by the bolt. Additionally, they regain additional hit points equal to the rolled amount each time they are healed until the end of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Apocalypse Seer lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: XpL0s10N 0F C0l0rZ
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals force damage, your patron gift activates right after the casting of the spell. Additionally, casting the magic missile spell will now share the same effects of your patron gift.

subclassFeature.name: B-B-B3aTdR0PD
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, you add your Charisma modifier to the damage. Additionally, roll a 1d100, following the rules of Wild Magic Surge from the Wild Magic Sorcerer subclass feature.

subclassFeature.name: Z3 CaLM B4 Z3 CHa0S
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Apocalypse Seer feature}
Whenever you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, roll thrice and roll a 1d3 to see which of these effects would occur.

subclassFeature.name: CyB3R'D + PUnK'D (W3 R0WDY)
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Apocalypse Seer feature}
You can cast the {@spell animate objects} spell once per short rest. You can also use your warlock spell slots to cast it again.

subclassFeature.name: RaV3 4 D4 Gr4VE
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Apocalypse Seer feature}

When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. When you use this feature, you are under the Ravemaster state for 1 minute or until you are knocked unconscious. While under the Ravemaster state, you have halved your movement speed but every 5 feet that you move conjures a magic bolt as per the patron gift feature.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Nostalgic Falsehoods|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Lingering Bliss|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Nostalgic Falsehoods
entries: As an action, you can attempt to gain access to all information that the humanoid would freely share with a casual acquaintance as long as you can make physical contact with them as they are in deep sleep. This would be a contested Insight (Wisdom) check against the target's character level + their Deception (Charisma) bonus. You can only attempt this feature on a creature once during their slumber.

As an action, you can attempt to change the course of a creature's dreams as long as you can make physical contact with them as they are in deep sleep. This would be a contested Deception (Charisma) check against the target's character level + their Insight (Wisdom) bonus. You can only attempt this feature on a creature once during their slumber.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Lingering Bliss lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

entries.caption: Lingering Bliss Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell mordenkainen's private sanctum}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Cradle the Forlorn
entries: You gain an additional hit die for each level invested into this class. At the end of a short rest, you can spend Hit Dice to regain the hit points of creatures of your choice that you take the short rest with. Additionally, you add your Charisma modifier for each hit die spent when determining regain hit points on a short rest.

Sleeping does not render you fully unconscious, as you can see and hear as normal within a 30-foot radius around you. While sleeping, you can't be surprised and you have a +10 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score.

subclassFeature.name: Nurture Hope
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Lingering Bliss feature}

After a long rest, you regain all of your missing hit dice for this class and you may change a number of your spells known equal to your Charisma modifier. You have an additional warlock spell slot which can be used until 8 hours after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Repose
entries: {@i 10th-level Pact of the Lingering Bliss feature}
After a long rest, you can change all of the eldritch invocations that you know.

subclassFeature.name: Delightful Dreams For The Drowsy
entries: {@i 14th-level Pact of the Lingering Bliss feature}

After a short rest, you can replenish a use of a single resource for creatures that you take the short rest with. The resource chosen must be one that regains uses on a long rest. This can be either racial features, class features, combat archetype features, spell slots, or et cetera as long as the resource is innate to the character. You cannot replenish magic item usages through this.

entries.subclassFeature: Patron Gift: Rejecting Rejection|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Middling Realities|ASS|1
Silver Tongue, Golden Wit|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Middling Realities|ASS|1
Glances Speak Many Words|Warlock (Sidera Dominiae)|ASS|Middling Realities|ASS|1

subclassFeature.name: Patron Gift: Rejecting Rejection
entries: You are not affected by magical effects that send you to another plane of existence or teleport you without your consent.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Middling Realities lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell.

subclassFeature.name: Silver Tongue, Golden Wit
entries: Words are tools, best keep them sharp.

You have advantage on checks that require any of your mental ability scores as long as you are in a debate. Additionally, you learn three languages of your choice and you have a vague general idea on what is said when hearing a language that you do not know.

subclassFeature.name: Glances Speak Many Words
entries: Thoughts are ideas, ideas are thoughts.

You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language. The targeted creature can telepathically respond to your message if you allow it to.

subclassFeature.name: Information, Arsenal
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Middling Realities feature}
To prevail, strength is but a factor the size of an ant.

You make Martial (Wisdom) and Arcana (Intelligence) checks with advantage when used to discern the capabilities of a combatant. Additionally, you have an additional free knowledge check during your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Intents, Audacities
entries: To prevail, sleuths be damned.

Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. You also have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you do.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Gift
entries: {@i 6th-level Pact of the Middling Realities feature}
[REDACTED]
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

subclassFeature.name: Fell Gift
entries: [REDACTED]

You learn the {@spell darkness} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot or material components. Additionally, you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Declaration of The Demifeyl
entries: They will listen.

As an action, you can attempt to rewrite your immediate relations with a creature that you can see and that can hear you within 60 feet of you. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they are either friendly, indifferent, or hostile towards you for 1 minute. When the effect ends, the creatures returns their natural state and must make an Insight (Wisdom) check to remember what they have done and how you forcefully influenced them.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Scrivener
entries: The gold and time you must spend to copy a spell that has the ritual tag into your spellbook is halved. Additionally, you can copy any spell that is not a part of the wizard spell list as long as it has the ritual tag.

subclassFeature.name: Composed Quillhand
entries: Your scribing hand remains still and composed even as you are forcibly distracted in conducting your rituals. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage while casting a ritual. In addition, when you cast a wizard spell as a ritual, you can instead add a minute per spell level rather than adding 10 minutes to it.

subclassFeature.name: Compounded Hieroglyphics
entries: {@i 6th-level School of Ritualism feature}

You learn of a way to conduct a ritual that allows you to draw upon the natural arcana of your surroundings to supplant the ritual's glyphs and your magical spellbook with arcane energies. As an action, you can begin a ritual for a wizard spell in your spellbook. The spell chosen must have an instantaneous duration and its slot level can only be up to your Intelligence modifier but does not need to have the ritual tag.

When you begin the ritual, it starts as having a 1st level spell slot and you can use an action to further its progress, increasing the spell level by 1, up to your Intelligence modifier. Once the ritual reaches a spell slot level that is equivalent or greater than the chosen spell's spell slot level required to cast, you can complete the ritual as an action and unleash its spell effect without using a spell slot. In addition, you can use a bonus action to cast a 1st-level wizard spell that you have prepared without using a spell slot as long as it has an instantaneous duration, you may only perform this bonus action if you use an action for this ritual.
You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rewritten Rulings
entries: {@i 10th-level School of Ritualism feature}

You rewrite the formulas of spells that you have mastered. As part of you preparing your spells after a long rest, you can choose a number of spells that you have in your spell book equal to your Intelligence modifier. The spell slot level of these spells can only be up to half of your proficiency modifier. The chosen spells gain the ritual tag.

subclassFeature.name: Defied Universal Conventions
entries: {@i 14th-level School of Ritualism feature}

You cheat the natural flow of the leylines and learn how to cheapen the costs of casting magic without sacrificing any effects. Over the course of 8 hours, you can conduct a special ritual. Choose a spell in your spell book that has the ritual tag. After successfully conducting the ritual, you can cast that spell at will for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Panacea
entries: There is a certain formula that is legendary to those that practice the alchemical arts: the Panacea that can cure any and all diseases. Those that spend their life to work on such an achievement are titled by the same thing that their efforts lead up to.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this field of study, you gain proficiency with the Medicine skill.

subclassFeature.name: Formula: Salve
entries: You can create salve bombs. My mixing your bomb's explosive reagent with a slurry of antiseptic oil, you can change it into a salve bomb. A salve bomb deals no damage, and instead each creature within its blast radius regains hit points equal to 1d6 plus half your alchemist level.

subclassFeature.name: Formula: Greater Salve
entries: {@i 6th-level Panacea feature}
You can enhance the potency of your salve bombs. You can spend any number of reagent die and have that be the resulting roll for the hit points regained by a salve bomb.

subclassFeature.name: Formula: Panacea
entries: You have distilled a formula that can serve as a cure-all. You can spend 4 reagent die or more to create a panacea bomb. A panacea bomb deals no damage, and instead grants creatures within its blast radius the effects of the lesser restoration spell and you reduce any special damage types such as bleed and rupture by a number equal to the resulting roll of your spent reagent dice.

subclassFeature.name: Personalized Medicine
entries: {@i 10th-level Panacea feature}

When you make a bomb whose formula is one that you learn as part of this subclass, its detonation range is increased to a 20-foot radius and you can designate which creatures can be affected by the explosion if they are within range.

subclassFeature.name: Formula: Veil
entries: Prevention is better than the cure. You can spend any number of reagent die to create a veiling bomb. A veiling bomb deals no damage, and instead grants temporary hit points that can only be used for special damage types such as bleed and rupture. These temporary hit points last until the end of your next turn and can coexist alongside other sources of temporary hit points. The amount of temporary hit points gained from this feature equals to the resulting roll of your spent reagent dice + half your alchemist level.

subclassFeature.name: Healing Rain
entries: {@i 18th-level Panacea feature}

Over the course of a long rest, you can create a special raining bomb which contains one of the formulae that you learn as part of this subclass. When thrown, an area within a 15-foot radius of its thrown space has a lingering effect of the designated formula which lasts for 30 seconds and takes effect at the start of your turn. The potency of this effect has the same level as if you had spent half of your total reagent dice on creating the bomb.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline of Mortal Terminus
entries: The cosmic weight of the stars and the cosmos of Astella can cause you to be blinded by their interstellar grandeur but make no mistake, your very being, flesh and bone and all, are still very much a part of the intertwining universe.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Sin
entries: You condemn yourself to a lifetime of eternal damnation to pursue the calling of transmuting mortal life, though who your judge and executioner is up for debate. When choosing this subclass at 2nd level, you become eligible for learning {@filter spells|spells|subschool=hemomancy} with the hemomancy tag and they count as astromancer spells for you. When you deal damage to another creature with a spell with the hemomancy tag, you can cause them take the spell's damage as bleed damage instead. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals damage to you such as the {@spell life transference|XGE} spell, spells with the hemomancy tag, or being hit by your own spell, you instead take the damage as bleed damage, halved.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Starlight
entries: {@i 6th-level Discipline of Mortal Terminus feature}

On your palm, you hold and manifest a blooming red scar that gives birth to ruination and prosperity. You gain a new attack option that you can use with the Attack action. The special attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 30 feet. You are proficient with it, and you add your spellcasting ability to its attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the creature takes 2d8 bleed damage and you apply a starmote on them that lasts until the start of their next turn. A starmote applied this way cannot be used for its intended effects other than light but instead causes the creature to not have their bleed damage activate at the start of their turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lysis Edict
entries: {@i 10th-level Discipline of Mortal Terminus feature}
You see now within your eyes the fabrics torn as blood is shed, and you hold within your mind both shear and thread for it. You learn the two following reactions:

items: {@b {@i Genesis.}} Before a creature takes damage from bleed at the start of their turn, you can remove a portion of their accumulated bleed damage equal to your astromancer level + your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, this removes any additional bleed damage conversions that they may have but still retaining the accumulated bleed damage.

{@b {@i Terminus.}} When a creature takes damage from bleed at the start of their turn, you can reduce how much their bleed damage is reduced by equal to your astromancer level + your Intelligence modifier.

entries: These reactions can only be used on a creature that you can see and counts as counting a spell with a level equal to your maximum active starmote count. This feature can only be used a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Pillars of Salt
entries: {@i 14th-level Discipline of Mortal Terminus feature}

The human flesh anatomy is made of the most basic of elements yet in harmony, they are far greater than the sum of their parts. You learn how to extract these elements and mold them for destruction. When you deal bleed damage, you can convert all of their accumulated bleed damage into any astral damage type that you choose. Any bleed damage that they take while this conversion is in effect will accumulate in the same way but the affected creature loses all accumulated bleed once they take damage from it.
You can only use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Iron Maiden
entries: Barbarians who follow the Path of the Iron Maiden regale themselves to a twisted suit of thorns that pierces the skin and drips their blood with every step. Perhaps due to a ravenous desire for redemption, or a twisted carnal desire for pain, none of these barbarians are truly the same with one another as their suits are almost always weighed down heavily with a deep and personal reason as to why one dons them.

subclassFeature.name: Thorned Punishment
entries: In one way or another, you can create your own pain and suffering no matter where and no matter when. Over the course of an hour, you can fashion a set of spikes that can be worn over your armor. These can be of any material that you choose or seems appropriate in the environment, and while worn, it requires an hour's worth of effort to doff. You gain the following benefits while wearing these spikes:

items: At the start of your turn, you take bleed damage equal to half of your barbarian level. While out of combat, you take this damage every hour instead.

When you make an unarmed strike, you deal additional bleed damage equal to half your AC once per creature per turn. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. This damage increases to 1d8 at 5th level, 1d10 at 11th, 1d12 at 17th.
While raging, you deal bleed damage to all creatures adjacent to you at the start of your turn. This bleed damage equals to half your barbarian level, which is doubled if you are grappling them.

subclassFeature.name: Penance and Atonement
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of the Iron Maiden feature}

Cast aside your punishments and ingrain every painful lesson into memory. As an action, you can expend your hit dice, up to your proficiency bonus. Roll the hit dice + your Constitution modifier for each of them and regain hit points equal to the result. After using this action, you gain temporary hit points equal to your AC.

subclassFeature.name: Chains of Misery
entries: {@i 10th-level Path of the Iron Maiden feature}

An evil predefined is one that extends their suffering to another, but you could care less of such. When rolling to grapple another creature and your resulting roll is lower than your AC, you can use your AC instead for the result. This feature can only be used while wearing a set of spikes as per the thorned punishment subclass feature.

subclassFeature.name: The Iron Maiden
entries: {@i 14th-level Path of the Iron Maiden feature}

Struck by endless fervid, the thorns that you wear simply are not enough. When creating a set of spikes through your Thorned Punishment subclass feature, you can grant it one of the following modifiers:

items: {@b {@i Deep Spikes.}} Any bleed damage that you inflict to yourself and other creatures is doubled. The bleed damage you take at the start of turn and every hour, you now take every 2 turns and every 2 hours instead but you reduce your maximum hit points equal to half of the bleed damage taken and can only regain these hit points after a long rest.

{@b {@i Iron Shell.}} You gain a +1 to AC and creatures that make a melee attack against you takes bleed damage as if you hit them with an unarmed strike. This trait can only deal bleed damage once per creature per turn.
{@b {@i Thorned Caestus.}} Your unarmed strikes now bleed damage every time you hit but you also take piercing damage equal to your unarmed strikes' base damage.
{@b {@i Barbed Wires.}} While you are grappling another creature, they take bleed damage equal to your Strength modifier each time you expend 10 feet of movement.

subclassFeature.name: College of Fools
entries: Bards of the College of Fools see the world as an orchestra in which they play two roles. They cause applause and they cease it. Make no mistake in the name of their profession, they are truly fearsome assassins that know how to pull the strings of their targets' hearts, and how to rip away their torsos to reach them.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you join the College of Fools at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with medium armor, martial weapons, and the Stealth skill.

subclassFeature.name: Sharpened Sickles
entries: You are a blade in the dark, thus you need to be sharpened. When you land a melee weapon attack, you can deal additional bleed damage to the target equal to your proficiency bonus. After dealing this damage, you can move to an adjacent tile without provoking any attacks of opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Gallows Humor
entries: You are a mask of laughter and sadness in front of the curtains, thus you take advantage of empathy. When you cast an enchantment or an illusion spell, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration class feature to increase their DC by 1. You can only use this feature up to your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level College of Fools feature}
Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lofty Laughter, Sought Slaughter
entries: {@i 14th-level College of Fools feature}

The pinnacle of your art reaches its climax in blood, song, and tears. Any hit you score against a creature that is surprised, charmed, or terrified is a critical hit and deals additional bleed damage equal to your weapon's base damage. The critical hit effect can only be used once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Flagellant Vow
entries: Monks of the Way of the Flagellant Vow break themselves to bring aid and peace to those in need. Many monks of this tradition are covered in scars - some self-inflicted in their practice and others earned in battle. The monks often see these scars as proof of life, of past, present, and a future awaiting.

subclassFeature.name: Flagellant Vow
entries: You use your ki to inflict wounds. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to have all of your damage deal bleed damage instead and extra damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature once per turn without expending a ki point at 11th level.

subclassFeature.name: Flowing Rivers
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of the Flagellant Vow feature}
The wounds that you sustain fill you with determination. After you take damage from bleed and your hit points are below half your maximum, you regain one use of your ki points.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Mercy
entries: {@i 11th-level Way of the Flagellant Vow feature}

The quicker you finish your battle, the quicker you can forgive yourself and one another. Each time your accumulated bleed exceeds your monk level + your Constitution modifier, you gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls per increment (up to a maximum of +3). You also deal extra bleed damage to your attacks equal to your Wisdom modifier while you are bleeding.

subclassFeature.name: Crown of the Martyr
entries: {@i 14th-level Way of the Flagellant Vow feature}

Cleanse unrighteousness and sins, even if they are not of yours. Whenever a creature adjacent to you takes damage, you can use your reaction to take all of that damage instead as bleed damage. This does not expend your reaction for the turn.

subclassFeature.name: Pursuer
entries: Pursuers are type of Ranger can be seen more like tacticians and night stalkers as they prepare for a long but effortless hunt that guarantees their prey slaughtered. They lay down traps and barb the tips of their arrows to ensure they can manipulate how their hunts will go: slow and painful for their trophy.

subclassFeature.name: Moribund
entries: You can ensure a guaranteed slow demise to your quarry. Whenever you hit a favored enemy or a marked creature with an attack, you deal bleed damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Entrapment
entries: Your knowledge in trap-laying allows you quick and efficient usage of them. You can lay down traps or similar items as a bonus action. You also cannot involuntarily trigger any traps that you set.

subclassFeature.name: Pursue
entries: {@i 7th-level Pursuer feature}

First step is to make them bleed, the second is to scare them away. As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed towards an enemy that is bleeding. Additionally, creatures that you mark cannot have their accumulated bleed to be lower than half your ranger level.

subclassFeature.name: Ensnare
entries: An extra step that goes a long way, for yourself at the very least. Whenever you deal damage to a bleeding creature, you reduce their movement by 5 feet until the end of their next turn. This bonus stacks up to a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Butcher
entries: {@i 11th-level Pursuer feature}

Your plans are underway and just a few more shots can help you settle this hunt. Attacking a prone creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls and targeting a favored enemy or a marked creature ignores half cover and three-quarters cover.

subclassFeature.name: Terminate
entries: {@i 15th-level Pursuer feature}

Efficiency is at peak and the time to reap the benefits is nigh. While attacking a favored enemy or a marked creature, your critical hit range increases by 1, which doubles if their hit points are below half their maximum. If a target's hit points are below half their maximum, you deal additional bleed damage to them equal to your ranger level once per creature per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Scrapper
entries: You hail from a tough background that involves lots of back-breaking labor focused on object-breaking. You develop a knack for breaking down things, and with a gun on hand, that talent extends to people now.

subclassFeature.name: Hot Fuses
entries: You aim at your enemies like a miner swinging a pickaxe, or a bear ready to maul: ensuring destruction. You learn two new grit features:

items: {@b {@i Wrenched Plans.}} You can spend 1 grit point as a bonus action to ensure that the critical hit range bonus you gain from the Deadeye class feature will not decrease from missing with an attack until the start of your next turn.

{@b {@i Screwed Drivers.}} Before making a ranged attack with a firearm, you can spend 1 grit point to have that attack count as a critical hit as long as it hits the target. This does not double the amount of damage dice rolls as per a critical hit but does activate other features that have a critical hit condition.

subclassFeature.name: Sledge the Hammer
entries: {@i 6th-level Scrapper feature}

You develop a technique that can ensure a huge blow with a heavy draw. When you land a critical hit with a firearm, you can deal additional rupture damage equal to your Dexterity modifier per extra critical hit range. Using this feature resets the bonuses from your Deadeye class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Wrecking Ball
entries: {@i 10th-level Scrapper feature}

Your bullets come in like a metallic sphere of sorts designed for demolition. You have advantage on ranged attacks using a firearm when targeting a creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal. You also deal double damage to objects and structures when you make a ranged attack using a firearm.

subclassFeature.name: Junkyard Shift
entries: {@i 17th-level Scrapper feature}
Fuckin' 'em up is an easy task that you can do all day long. When you land a critical hit with a firearm you deal the extra damage from rupture but does not consume it.

subclassFeature.name: Anatomist
entries: Anatomists see the greatness and the weaknesses of the human anatomy. They spend their life studying anatomy and the inner workings of mortal creatures, and use this knowledge to sculpt bodies into art, albeit gruesome and cringeworthy to watch in action.

subclassFeature.name: Student of Medical Malpractice
entries: You gain proficiency in Medicine and Athletics. Whenever you make a check with either of these proficiencies you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die. If you are already proficient in either skill you instead gain proficiency in another skill from the Savant list.
Moreover, your medical training and insight into anatomy grants you the benefits below:

items: Whenever you would make a Wisdom (Medicine) check, you can make an Intelligence (Medicine) check instead.

The first time a creature becomes your Focus during combat, you deal rupture damage to them equal to a roll of your Intellect die + half your savant level (rounded up). You also learn their Constitution score.
Once per turn, if you hit your Focus with a weapon attack, you can give advantage to the next attack made to it. When that attack hits, it deals the extra damage from rupture but does not consume it.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Massager
entries: You have trained extensively in knowledge surrounding massages, pressure points, and stretches. When you finish a short or long rest, you grant up to three creatures (one on a short rest), a bonus to their hit point maximum and current hit points by a roll of your Intellect Die + half your savant level (rounded up).
Also, your knowledge of anatomy grants you the Expert Massager abilities below, each of which takes an action to use.
{@b {@i Pressure Point: Revitalize.}} You touch another creature and you remove one point of their exhaustion. You can only use this feature on the same creature once per long rest.

{@b {@i Pressure Point: Loosen.}} You touch another creature that is either restrained, paralyzed, stunned, and it instantly repeats a saving throw to end that condition with a bonus to its roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die.

{@b {@i Pressure Point: Stiffen.}}You touch another creature that is prone and you grant them the restrained condition until the end of their next turn. You can only use this feature on the same creature once per a number of turns equal to their Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unethical Chiropractice
entries: You can extend your expertise to others with a little bit of advice on anatomy. When you use your Portent Observation class feature, you can cause the bonus from the feature to deal rupture damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Unethical Chiropractice
entries: {@i 6th-level Anatomist feature}

You can extend your expertise to others with a little bit of advice on anatomy. When you use your Portent Observation class feature, you can cause the bonus from the feature to deal rupture damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: North Star Alignment
entries: {@i 10th-level Anatomist feature}
Your expertise in pressure points reaches a new height: to the stars. You learn the Expert Massager abilities below, and you can use each of them successfully once per long rest.

{@b {@i Pressure Point: Resuscitate.}} You touch another creature that has their hit points reduced to 0. You roll your Intellect Die a number times equal to your Intelligence modifier and you add your savant level to the result. That creature gains hit points equal to the result and they do not suffer a point of exhaustion for exiting that state.
{@b {@i Pressure Point: Paralyze.}} You touch another creature that has their speed reduced to 0. They must make a Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Master Anatomist
entries: {@i 15th-level Anatomist feature}

You can perform legendary dissections of anatomy. When you use the Help action to aid an ally in attack a creature, they gain a bonus to their critical hit range by a roll of your Intellect Die. If that attack lands a critical hit, the target takes rupture damage equal to your savant level.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Breakers
entries: Pugilists in the Shield Breakers fight club train to knock down opposition of a greater level than them. They don't go for boxers with just their trousers on but big metal walls taller than they can afford to buy.

subclassFeature.name: Banged-up Metal
entries: Your fists leave dents on the metal it touches. Once per turn, you can choose to deal additional rupture damage equal to your fisticuffs die when you land an attack using an unarmed strike or a pugilist weapon. You roll this dice again and add it to the resulting roll if the target is wearing heavy armor, donning a shield, a structure, an object, or a construct.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy Haymakers
entries: {@i 6th-level Shield Breakers feature}
A big swing for a big enemy. When you hit with an attack that uses your Haymaker class feature, you deal the extra damage from rupture but does not consume it.

subclassFeature.name: Fists Like Hammers
entries: {@i 11th-level Shield Breakers feature}

You do more than just dent, you rupture. If a creature you deal damage to has traits listed in the Banged-up Metal subclass feature, you can reduce their AC by 1 for 10 minutes. A creature can only be affected by this feature a number of times equal to half of your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: All Becomes Malleable
entries: {@i 17th-level Shield Breakers feature}

Your attacks start going through armor, now you punch down on vitals most especially if there is a wall behind them. When you land an attack using an unarmed strike or a pugilist weapon and the target's rupture is higher than their Constitution score, you can reduce all of their ability scores by 1 for 1 minute. A creature can only be affected by this feature twice.
Additionally, you can apply your Fists Like Hammers subclass feature on a critical hit, even if they do not have the listed traits.

subclassFeature.name: Reaper
entries: You focus your training on the grim of death. A dark hooded figure in flowing black robes, revealing a cruel wickedness that does not discriminate. With a single slice, a single soul yielded.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Touch
entries: Pure death is all that you leave in your wake. When you make a weapon attack with advantage, you can choose to deal its base damage rolls as rupture damage.

subclassFeature.name: Death's Doors
entries: {@i 9th-level Reaper feature}

Your arsenal are like keys to death's doors. You gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack, you don't need advantage on your attack roll to use Sneak Attack against a creature that has hit points less than a quarter of their maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Reap
entries: {@i 13th-level Reaper feature}

The phantom of death becomes busy in a grand battlefield. When you hit a creature that has rupture damage, you can use your reaction to make another weapon attack against them. You regain your action and movement for the turn if you reduce the target's hit points to 0, you only gain this benefit once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: March To Impending Doom
entries: {@i 17th-level Reaper feature}

The sounds of your daggers unsheathing, your blade slitting throats, and the gushing out of fresh blood, like the trumpeters of apocalypse. You can deal your Sneak Attack damage as rupture damage thrice per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Huntsman
entries: You follow the way of a quick hunt. A Wild Huntsman breaks down their target piece by piece, enough to make it so that their pack can share the same effectivity in their actions.

subclassFeature.name: Fragility
entries: You wrench open a gap in the defenses of your marked prey. When a creature is both marked by you (or a favored enemy) and has rupture, you can cause your next attack on them to cause fragility on a hit consuming the rupture. This fragility lasts until the start of your next turn and each time a fragile creature takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, they take additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Causing fragility while it is active does not do anything.

subclassFeature.name: Hole In The Man
entries: {@i 7th-level Wild Huntsman feature}

A shot that pierces through the thickest of hides. Once per turn, an attack you make on a marked creature additionally deals rupture damage equal to mark's damage or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.

subclassFeature.name: Sawed-Teeth Traps
entries: You modify the traps that you lay to increase its efficiency. Creatures affected by a trap that you lay are counted as marked for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Fragility
entries: {@i 11th-level Wild Huntsman feature}
Fur, then skin, then flesh, then bones, your shots open up a weak spot like a broken river dam. The fragility that you cause now lasts until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Hunter's Mark
entries: {@i 15th-level Wild Huntsman feature}

You have unparalleled focus when it comes to stomping down on your target's day. When a marked creature takes damage and they do not have any rupture, you can cause them to take rupture damage equal to your proficiency bonus from the attack. Each time this feature takes effect, the mark's duration is reduced by 1 round.
In addition, you can cast the hunter's mark spell without expending any spells slots.

race.name: Human (Schmariant)
entries: The local denizens of Astella. Humble (to varying degrees) and skilled (to varying degrees), each and every single one of them are a part of why the universe is special.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Prodigy
entries: You start out with the {@feat prodigy|XGE} racial feat.

race.name: Aegir
entries: The term 'Aegir' is an umbrella term that encompasses various races possessing traits of aquatic animals, i.e., fish, cetaceans, pinnipeds, cephalopods, crustaceans, cnidarians, and echinoderms. Various Aegir possess distinctive traits; some might possess more animalistic traits, i.e., tentacles and fish fins, while others are completely humanoid.

Most Aegir are well-adept to water, but not all of them could fully live an aquatic life. Breathing underwater is a unique trait of the Aegir race and a common feature among the Aegir is their total reliance on water to maintain their skin moisture, which are higher than average land-dwellers. On the other hand, this means that Aegirs are highly susceptible to dehydration. Their respiratory systems are completely reliant on air moisture, and they have to supervise their skin moisture upon contacting wind and sunlight to prevent them from turning dry.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Aegir Aquatic Traits
entries: You can choose up to two from the following aquatic traits:

items: {@b {@i Carapace Shell.}} You gain a +1 bonus to your armor class, whether or not you are wearing armor.
{@b {@i Deep Sea Swimmer.}} Your darkvision has a radius of 120 feet and you can discern all colors in the darkness if it is underwater.
{@b {@i Fast Swimmer.}} You have a swimming speed double your walking speed.

{@b {@i Ink Sac.}} As an action, you can secrete ink on a creature adjacent to you. The creature must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute or until wiped off as an action. Once you use this ability, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.
{@b {@i Powerful Build.}} You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
{@b {@i Slippery Skin.}} You have advantage on ability checks you make to escape grapple, slip bindings, and escape nets.

{@b {@i Tentacle Tails.}} You have a set of tentacles on your rear that can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.
{@b {@i Toxin Tolerance.}} You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself.

{@b {@i Venomous Secretions.}} When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal 1d8 poison damage to that creature. If you are swimming, this ability does not cost a reaction. Once you use this ability, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.
The damage increases to 2d8 at 6th level, 3d8 at 11th level, and 4d8 at 16th level, and you gain another usage each time.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You can breathe normally in either air or water, and you have a resistance to cold damage.

race.name: Anaty
entries: Anaties have the traits of musteloids, i.e., otters, weasels, raccoons, and wolverines. Their musteloid traits can be noticed such as rounded ears and long, pointed tails being either slim or rounded and bushy, though not all Anaties have animal ears.

They are a race that is commonly associated with the mountains because most of them have been living in such regions since the distant past. They also have the tradition of welcoming any guest they could encounter. Despite their feeble bodies, Anaties are excellent diggers and mountain climbers thanks to their geographical adaptation and thanks to their anatomy, Anaties have an agile mobility that allows them to easily run and walk through rugged mountains.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small, and you have a burrowing speed equal to half of your walking speed.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Anaty Crawl
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your walking speed. This movement frees your from grapples, does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and you can stand up from prone after this movement. You can only use this feature once per short rest.

entries.name: Adaptive Dwellers
entries: You have proficiency in the Nature and Survival skills. Additionally, you ignore difficult terrain when walking on rough ground and loose soil.

entries.name: Swift Scurrying
entries: You can move through other creatures' space without it being treated as walking on difficult terrain

race.name: Anura
entries: Anurans have the traits of frogs and toads. Though appearing entirely humanoid similar to the Aegirs, their anuran traits can be noticed such as patches of frog-like skin, preference over moist environments, and their capability to secrete toxins. Many Anurans master camouflage and invisibility magic, and some individuals can utilize their toxins as poisons for self-defense. On the other hand, these toxins can also be easily neutralized through their immunity, and they can control the amount of their poison's toxicity.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Anura Neurotoxin
entries: As a bonus action, you can secrete up to 4 ounces of toxin. When coated on a weapon or ingested, the creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Your body can hold up to 4 times your Constitution modifier in ounces of this poison and you regain 4 ounces after a long rest. When secreted, this toxin loses after 10 minutes if not used.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe normally in either air or water.

entries.name: Biologically Camouflaged
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Biologically Toxic
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. Additionally, you are resistant to poison damage.

race.name: Aslan
entries: Aslans have the traits of lions. Their leon traits can be noticed such as rounded ears, tails with dark tuffs of hair, mane-like hairstyle, and physical prowess. Aslans are very identical to the Felines; in fact, they are actually a Feline subgroup in biological and anthropological definitions, but they are separated independently as a royal bloodline due to politics.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Aslan Kingship
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell command} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell enthrall} spell with it, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Natural Greatness
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Athletics, Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Stalwart Reign
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

race.name: Caprinae
entries: Caprinae have the traits of goats and sheep. Their caprine traits can be noticed such as curved keratin horns, perky or floppy ears, and short tails pointing straight up. They possesses regular physical fitness and reflexive nimbleness.

A notable trait of the Caprinae is their superiority in magic. A theory suggests that their excellent arcane talent is born from a combination of both their physical characteristics and their nimbleness. However, some of them cannot naturally use magic due to their innate physique or any other birth defect, though they can possess unimaginable physical strength that supplements the defect.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Caprinae Inclination
entries: You can choose from one of the two traits that determine whether you are more talented in the arcane or your physical prowess.

items: {@b {@i Caprinae Spellcasting.}} Choose two schools of spellcasting. Your spellcasting modifier increases by 1 whenever casting a spell from the chosen schools.
{@b {@i Caprinae}} Might. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls when making weapon attacks.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells.

entries.name: Mirthful Leaps
entries: Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as usual.

entries.name: Ram
entries: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

race.name: Cautus
entries: Cautuses have the traits of leporids, i.e., rabbits and hares. Their leporid traits can be noticed such as long rabbit ears, fluffy short tails, and average short stature. Their rabbit ears grant them a keen hearing sense which supplements their fragile body. Thanks to these traits along with their high fertility, Catuses have a very large population.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Cautus Fortune
entries: You gain 2 luck points as per the {@feat Lucky} feat.

entries.name: Hare-Trigger
entries: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls.

entries.name: Leporine Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Hoppy Footwork
entries: When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll a d4 and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. You can't use this reaction if you're prone or your speed is 0.

entries.name: Rabbit Hop
entries: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your proficiency bonus, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

race.name: Cerato
entries: Ceratoes have the traits of rhinoceroses. Their rhinoceros traits can be noticed such as a single or double pointed keratin horn on the forehead, rounded, tubular ears with tufts of hair on the top edge, muscularity, and average tall stature among adults. Even though Ceratoes could run like a Kuranta, they prefer to avoid long trekking. It is believed that their heavy weight due to their muscles could quickly exhaust their stamina when running, making it a tedious job to the Ceratoes.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Cerato Charge
entries: If you move at least 15 feet straight toward a target and make a melee attack, you roll the attack with advantage. Additionally, attacks of opportunity made against you after you use the Dash action on your turn is made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Horns
entries: You have horns that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Rhinoceros Senses
entries: You have advantage on checks that involve smell but have disadvantage on checks involving sight.

race.name: Draco
entries: Dracos have the traits of European dragons in Western mythology. Their draconic traits can be noticed such as dragon horns, hard scales, bulky and majestic serpentine tails, and highly advanced physical strength. Because of their identical similarities, Dracos can be easily mistaken as Vouivres. Nevertheless, Dracos can be easily distinct from Vouivres with one special trait: their capability to manipulate elements.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Draco Ancestry
entries: Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your destructive explosion and damage resistance are determined by the Dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Destructive Explosion
entries: You can choose to further bring your wrath upon your enemies with destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the damage type of the exhalation.

Once per turn, when you damage a creature, you can choose for the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your Proficiency Bonus. That creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, the type of which is determined by your Draconic ancestry, and half as much damage on a successful one.
You can use your destructive explosion a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

race.name: Elafia
entries: Elafians have the traits of deer. Their cervid traits can be noticed such as a pair of antlers, funnel-shaped ears, and short, rounded tails. During the early stage of their growth, their antlers are covered with skin known as velvet rather than keratin as in Caprinae and Fortes, and the velvet antlers possess nerve coverings that enable them to sense touches through their antlers. Elafians highly value their antlers as the symbol of their race. Young Elafians will interact with their velvet antlers to demonstrate their emotions, be it joy or arrogance.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Elafia Artistry
entries: Works made using an artisan's tools that you are proficient in are always of Masterwork quality. Additionally, you gain proficiency in 2 {@filter artisan's tools|items|search=artisan's tools} of your choice.

entries.name: Communion with Nature
entries: You can communicate simple ideas with flora and fauna. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. Additionally, you have proficiency in the Animal Handling and Nature skills.

race.name: Feline
entries: Felines have the traits of feliforms. They usually have the traits of domestic cats and big cats, though some individuals have the traits of mongooses. Their feline traits are visible from the shape of their ears and tail and their flexibility. Most Felines possess pointed, triangular ears and long tails, and only a few of them have rounded or folded ears and short tails. The Felinesâ€™ keen sense earns them their reputation as stealthy prowlers or flexible individuals. Some of them even possess light-sensitive pupils in which their eyes will form 'slit pupils' in areas with bright light.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small, and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Feline Agility
entries: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Cat's Talent
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

race.name: Forte
entries: Fortes have the traits of bovines, i.e., cattle, bison, and buffaloes. Their bovine traits can be noticed such as pointed keratin horns, rounded and protruding ears, tails with tuffs of hair, and their muscularity. There are several subgroups having the traits of camelids, i.e., camels and llamas, who possess camelid traits such as small, rounded ears and the ability to survive in arid deserts.

The Fortes' lack of flexibility is compensated with their excellent physical strength. Because of that, they are often stereotyped as merely physically strong yet brainless people, though many Forte are actually known for their philosophical wisdom, especially in settlements where they are the predominant race.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Forte Wisdom
entries: You always know which direction is north, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Survival) check you make to navigate or track. You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset. You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past year.

entries.name: Ancient Civilization Artisans
entries: You gain proficiency in one {@filter artisan's tools|items|search=artisan's tools} of your choice. You also have advantage on rolls pertaining to ancient culture.

entries.name: Horn
entries: You have horns that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Additional Language
entries: You learn another language of your choice.

race.name: Kuranta
entries: Kuranta have the traits of equines, i.e., horses, donkeys, and zebras. Their equine traits can be noticed such as funnel-shaped ears, tall stature, and tails being either bushy being nicknamed the 'skirt' or simply having tufts of long hair at the bottom of the tail dock. Although lacking the physical strength on par with the Ursi and Fortes, Kuranta possess an enduring stamina that grants them the ability to run at high speeds with little to no fatigue.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 40 feet, 35 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Kuranta Sprint
entries: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and you regain all uses after a long rest.

entries.name: Equine Build
entries: You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift. In addition, you add your Strength modifier twice when you make a running jump. This extra distance costs movement as usual.

entries.name: Far Traveler
entries: Once per long rest, you suffer no downsides after your first time travelling at a faster pace.

entries.name: Gallop On and Prevail
entries: You do not suffer from disadvantage when making attack rolls using lances or weapons with a similar special restriction.

race.name: Liberi
entries: The term 'Liberi' is an umbrella term that encompasses various races possessing traits of birds, i.e., feathers growing on their hair and structures resembling tail feathers on their torsos, or feather-like features. Along with feathers, they also possess a good sense of hearing and eyesight. Generally speaking, Liberi are a medium-sized race with females being slightly shorter. Their physical fitness is relatively average at best, and they are considerably lighter in weight than other races. Some Liberi possess the traits of various bird-like mythological creatures in our world, while others resemble anthropomorphic avians.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Liberi Adaptation
entries: You have proficiency in a saving throw of your choice and you can change this proficiency to a different saving throw at the end of a long rest.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Learnt Liberi
entries: You gain proficiency in either a skill of your choice; a weapon of your choice; a tool of your choice; or a learn a language.

race.name: Lung
entries: Lung have the traits of Chinese dragons, the Long, in East Asian mythology. Their Long traits can be noticed such as antler-like horns and serpentine tails with hair tufts. Some individuals can possess more animalistic traits such as carp-like whiskers, lion mane-like hair, deer-like ears, and fish fins and scales.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live to be about 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Lung Prosperity
entries: When you reach 5th and 17th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

entries.name: Reign over Rain
entries: You can cast {@spell fog cloud} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell create or destroy water} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell aqueous blast|ABYSS} spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Additional Language
entries: You learn another language of your choice.

race.name: Lupo
entries: Lupos have the traits of wolves. Their lupine traits can be noticed such as their pricked ears and bushy tails. They are one of the three races separated from the Perros due to cultural and biological differences along with the Vulpos and Reprobas. On the outside, they appear almost identical to a Perro, but they are also the easiest to be recognized through their unique culture.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 35 feet, 30 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Lupo Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated. Additionally, attacks that benefit from this trait also have their critical hit range increased by 1.

entries.name: Pack Sense
entries: You have advantage on checks that involve tracking as long as another person that you can see makes the same check. Additionally, you always know if a creature that you can see or smell is a lupine creature.

entries.name: Shifty
entries: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

race.name: Manticore
entries: Manticores have the traits of the namesake chimeric creature in Persian mythology. They can be seen on their bat wing-like appendixes on both sides of the head, and a scorpion tail on their torso, usually ending with a strong and sometimes poisonous stinger. They are generally roughly the height of an average human, though female Manticores are usually shorter than males, yet both genders demonstrate excellent physical flexibility.
They are also prominent in the use of the invisibility spell which allow them to camouflage and conceal themselves during ambush.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Manticore Ambush
entries: Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the invisibility spell with this trait without requiring any components, and starting at 7th level, you can also cast greater invisibility with it. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can accurately mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations only with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Stinger
entries: You have a stinger that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d8 + your Dexterity modifier poison damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

race.name: Perro
entries: Perros have the traits of dogs. Their canid traits can be easily noticed such as pricked, folded, or floppy ears, pointed or curled tails, and their keen sense of smell. Perros are known for demonstrating their emotions outwardly through their body parts such as wagging tail and folding ears.

A notable culture practiced among the Perros are their large family and their loyalty to their families and friends. In a traditional Perro community, the families that make up the community are regarded as part of a larger family. Because of their family culture, Perros highly values peace and harmony between family and friends. Even when one faces difficulties, a Perro will always stay on their side.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Perro Dogpile
entries: As a bonus action, you let out a cry at your enemies within 10 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies have advantage on attack rolls against any of those enemies who could hear you. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Bite
entries: You have a fanged maw that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Keen Sense
entries: Your sense of hearing and smell are better than most humanoids. You are proficient in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Natural Adored
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion.

race.name: Petram
entries: Petrams have the traits of turtles , i.e., tortoises, terrapins, and sea turtles. Unlike other races, they are totally humanoid and are completely devoid of any testudinate trait such as short tails, scales, and even shells. But somehow, they are incredibly robust and resilient.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their fifties and live around 250 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have a base AC of 18 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number) and damage that you take is reduced by 2. You can raise your guard as an action. Until you lower your guard as a bonus action, you gain a +4 bonus to your AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws but your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and you can't take reactions.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe normally in either air or water.

race.name: Phidia
entries: Phidians have the traits of snakes. Their serpentine traits can be noticed such as scaly tails, scales on parts of their bodies, and their extremely keen senses. Phidians possess a pair of pointed ears. Their average weight and muscularity are surprisingly below standard, yet their average height is taller than others, making their bodies appear slim and feeble.

Contrary to the popular belief, Phidians do not secrete venoms. A positive notation of a Phidian's character is perhaps the tendency to focus on a specific goal. They can dedicate themselves to a particular goal and will never be diverted from it despite the obstacles and disturbances.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
