entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Phidia Talents
entries: You gain three skill proficiencies of your choice, two tool proficiencies of your choice, and fluency in two languages of your choice.

entries.name: Blindsense
entries: You have blindsight with a range of 20 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

race.name: Pilosa
entries: Pilosa have the traits of sloths. Similar to the Petrams, Pilosas are entirely humanoid and are devoid of folivoran traits such as hairy fur and long claws. The only visible folivoran trait is their distinctive slow speech and actions, making them literally 'as slow as a sloth.' On the other hand, this disadvantage is compensated by their taciturn and cautious nature during work time.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet, 20 feet if you are Small, and you have a climbing speed and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Pilosa Dullness
entries: Being so slow to register and think makes you oblivious to charms and slow to recognize threats. You are immune to being charmed and you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. Additionally, you can't be surprised while you are conscious.

entries.name: Heavy Sleeper
entries: You must sleep at least 7 hours of a long rest and 30 minutes of a short rest that you take. After finishing either, you gain temporary hit points equal to your character level. While sleeping, you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

race.name: Reproba
entries: Reprobas have the traits of hyenas. Their hyenid traits can be noticed such as pricked ears and tails with tufts of hair, spots, or stripes. They have a moderate physical fitness when compared with other races, although female Reprobas are generally stronger than males.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Reproba Fury
entries: Creatures take an additional 1d6 damage when hit by your attacks of opportunity. Additionally, when you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals half your character level.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.

entries.name: Hyena Sprint
entries: When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Hardy Scavenger
entries: You can safely consume raw or rotting food and have advantage on saving throws against disease and ingested poison.

entries.name: Throat Lunge
entries: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee weapon attacks that do not have the two-handed, heavy, or special properties.

race.name: Savra
entries: Savrans have the traits of lizards that includes true lizards , i.e., geckos, chameleons, monitor lizards, and tuatara, and lizard-like animals, i.e., the amphibian salamanders. Their lacertilian and salamandrine traits can be noticed such as scales covering the bodies, scaly tails, and agileness.

Many Savrans also have the natural ability of camouflage by changing their skin color. As a matter of fact, many Savrans are talented hunters and ambushers who could perfectly blend with their surroundings after wearing camouflage clothing. Some of the Savrans' unusual characteristics are their elongated lifespan and their ectothermic bodies. While it is true that many Sarvans can live up to centuries, it has become a subject of stereotype due to exaggerations.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live to be about 150 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Savra Cunning
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10. Additionally, you can choose to automatically succeed a Wisdom check by meeting its average DC before it is rolled once per long rest.

entries.name: Biologically Camouflaged
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Nature's Intuition
entries: Thanks to your mystical connection to nature, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

entries.name: Salamander Skin
entries: You have resistance to fire damage. You also naturally acclimate to environment in extreme conditions caused by high heat.

race.name: Ursus
entries: Ursi have the traits of bears, i.e., brown bears, black bears, polar bears, and giant pandas. Their ursine traits can be seen from their rounded ears, short and unnoticeable tails, and a bulky stature than other humanoids. The Ursi's most distinguishable feats are their tall height and outstanding physical strength compared to other races, which are attributes they generally like to emphasize. They also possess a highly-developed endurance as a result of the harsh environment they live in, i.e., frigid winters in the northern regions.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Ursus Bomba
entries: You gain expertise in the Athletics skill, and you count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. You are also considered one size larger for the purposes of grappling, and shoving.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You also naturally acclimate to high altitudes, even if you've never been to one. This includes elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Ursine Instincts
entries: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell and you have proficiency in the Survival skill.

entries.name: Victory or Death
entries: As an action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. You gain temporary hit points equal to your level and creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

race.name: Vouivre
entries: Vouivres have the traits of 'lesser dragons,' i.e. dragon-like creatures in various mythologies such as wyverns, wyrms, hydras, drakes, and amphipteres. They are almost identical to the Dracos such as unique-shaped horns, large dragon-like tails, and supreme physical prowess, and this causes others to mistake both races frequently given the scarcity of the Draco population.

Their only difference from the Dracos are arcane talents; Vouivres lack the innate talent to enhance superior magics. Vouivres are able to regulate their own metabolism to reduce food consumption that is most likely as a survival mechanism against the harsh deserts where they originate from.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Vouivre Adrenaline
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started. Additionally, when you use your Relentless Endurance trait, make a critical hit, or reduce another creature's hit points to 0, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack.

entries.name: Militant Knowledge
entries: You have proficiency in the Martial skill and you are proficient in four weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

race.name: Vulpo
entries: Vulpos have the traits of foxes such as the â€œtrue foxesâ€ and other fox-like canids. Their vulpine traits can been noticed such as large, protruding ears and long, bushy tails unlike Lupos and Perros. They can be recognized through their medium-sized stature and their keen flexibility amongst other races. In fact, in the ancient era before their divergence from the Perros, Vulpos were often described as the 'most agile of Perros.' Because of their traits, many Vulpos are depicted as outstanding combatants in various cultures.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 40 feet, 35 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Vulpo Pace
entries: When determining your initiative, you can choose to increase your initiative result by up to your proficiency bonus or decrease it down to 1.

entries.name: Vulpo Cunning
entries: You gain proficiency in the Acrobatics, Insight, and Persuasion skills. Additionally, you add half of your proficiency bonus to Deception, Stealth, and Sleight of Hand checks that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

race.name: Zalak
entries: Zalaks have the traits of rodents, i.e., mice, squirrels, hamsters, prairie dogs, and beavers, although a few individuals have traits of rodent-like animals such as rat-like marsupials, i.e., opossums and Australasian possums, and small-sized insectivores, i.e., shrews and moles. Their rodent, possum, and insectivorous traits can be noticed such as pointed or rounded ears with hair tufts, slim or bushy tails, keen senses, average short stature, and high fertility.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Zalak Resourcefulness
entries: When scavenging or crafting items, they are always one tier quality higher.

entries.name: Adept Climber
entries: You have proficiency in your choice of the Athletics or Acrobatics skill. You have a climb speed equivalent to your walking speed.

entries.name: Crevice Crawler
entries: You can move through and stop in a space large enough to fit a creature one size smaller than you without squeezing.

entries.name: Scurry Away
entries: You can move up to half your speed as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

race.name: Anasa
entries: Anasa have the traits of demigods in Hindu-Buddhist mythology which include asuras, rakshasas, and yakshas. Physically, Anasa have horns and tails similar to the Sarkaz as well as a dark halo behind their heads, somewhat similar to a fallen Sankta. Another unique trait of the Anasa is their powerful body strength.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live around fifty years.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Anasa Soul Enlightment
entries: Once per long rest, you can give yourself truesight out to a range of 60 feet for 30 seconds. When this trait ends, you suffer 4 levels of exhaustion.

entries.name: Anasa Proficiencies
entries: You have proficiency in one skill of your choice and one tool of your choice. You also have proficiency in weapons that have the thrown property.

entries.name: Celestial Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

race.name: Oni
entries: As their name suggests, Oni have the traits of the titular ogre in Japanese mythology. They closely resemble the Sarkaz such as one or two horns on their foreheads, but they have a taller, bulkier, and muscular stature among both men and women. They are well-known for their rough nature due to their body strength which results in various stereotypes that they are barbaric, careless warriors.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Oni Ferocity
entries: You can use your action to unleash your inner power within yourself to make your abilities even more potent. The inner power lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, any heal rolls and damage rolls you make are increased by your proficiency bonus. You can only use this feature once every long rest.

entries.name: Ogre Hands
entries: When making a melee weapon attack, you can give it the heavy weapon property as long as it does not have the light weapon property.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

race.name: Sankta
entries: Sankta are humanoids with halos above their heads and luminescent 'wings' of varying shapes and sizes on their backs. The Sankta's halo is a physical object, preventing them from wearing any tall headwear that would cover it (e.g. conical party hats) although they can still wear most headwear as long as it is not too tall.

Their halos and wings will diminish upon death, and diseases or birth defects could affect them. There have been evidences that completely separate Sankta that have contracted Eldross infection from completely separate sources have had their halos mutated in the same manner, changing their shape to 3 overlapping rings with symmetrical feathered wings attached to each one.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Sankta Luminescence
entries: You have a halo that on top of your head and a set of glass-like wings that are always emanating a bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Additionally, you know the light cantrip and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Holy Resistance
entries: You are resistant to radiant damage.

entries.name: Patron Firearm
entries: You have proficiency with weapons that have the ammunition properties and firearms, you can also use Sanktan firearms. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with a ranged weapon attack. The extra radiant damage equals your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Sankta Lineage
entries: While not particularly treated as subspecies of Sankta, there are some features that a sankta has that are inherently innate to them but may differ from other sankta. Choose one of these lineages: Heavyblast, Hoverglass, Longshot, Quickdraw, or Surefire.

race.name: Sarkaz
entries: The term 'Sarkaz' does not actually refer to a specific race; rather, it is a derogatory umbrella term for various humanoid races who are linked to devil-like traits depending on their lineage. The most commonly noticed traits are a pair of horns of varying shapes atop their heads, long, pointed ears, and tails of varying shapes such as having pointed ends or scales. However, there are some Sarkaz lineages lacking any of the aforementioned traits.
In Velour, all humanoids were turned into Sarkaz when the Umbral Coven cursed the entirety of the Orange Star.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Sarkaz Hardships
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You also have advantage on death saving throws.

entries.name: Demonic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Extra Proficiencies
entries: You have proficiency in one skill of your choice and one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Sarkaz Lineage
entries: Sarkaz delineate themselves from a variety of races depending on their varied features, and sometimes lifestyle and diets. These range from Goliah, Sanguinarch, Buldrokkas, Caoineadh, Anzulithic, Zersetzen, Infernal, and Shayatin. Choose one of these subraces.

race.name: Saratolan Dragonborn
entries: In Saratola, the Land of Dragons, those with ancestry and lineage aligned with dragons have greater and more apparent attributes that accentuate their bloodline shared by the mighty beasts. Dragonborn are shaped like dragons in a human-sized form factor, and unlike those not from Saratola, these dragonborn can be born having tails and in even rarer cases, wings.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their early teens and live for many centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Dragon.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.

After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until it's recharged. At the start of each of your turns, provided you already used your draconic breath, you may roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, you regain the use of your draconic breath. Otherwise, your draconic breath recharges 1 minute after you used it or if you spend an action to recharge it.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Subraces
entries: Two main subraces of Dragonborn populate Saratola: Of The Lands, and Of The Skies. Choose one of these subraces.

race.name: Drakensoul
entries: Born of mortals yet their soul surges with the spirits of the 6 Great Saratolan Dragons. The Drakensoul are a race of humanoid creatures native to Saratola. The Drakensoul of Saratola appear to be more humanoid than the Dragonborn, having maintained more of the physical features of their mortal parents. Their draconic features are linked to the physical characteristics of the great dragon spirit that has blessed them.

entries.name: Age
entries: Drakensoul mature proportionally at the same rate as their mortal parent's race, but they can live up to 1000 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Spiritual Breath
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your spiritual ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your spiritual breath, each creature in the area of exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases by an additional 1d6 at 6th level, 11th level, and 16th level.

After you use your spiritual breath, you can't use it again until it's recharged. At the start of each of your turns, provided you already used your spiritual breath, you may roll a d6. On a 6, you regain the use of your spiritual breath. Otherwise, your spiritual breath recharges 1 minute after you used it.

entries.name: Spiritual Ancestry
entries: While the dragonborn reflect more on their draconic ancestry, the drakensoul follows either the path of the Four Guardians of Saratola which are Baihu the White, Qinglong the Green, Xuanwu the Blue, and Zhuque the Red or the Heavenly Twins, Huanglong and Qilin. Each one representing Saratola's link to the Elemes Giga-Cosmos or the Fey and Fell Cosmos, in the case of the Heavenly Twins.
Your breath weapon deals elemental damage of the type associated with your chosen subrace. In addition, your ability scores increase as described, and you gain an additional draconic trait.

race.name: Daemonsoul
entries: Daemonsouls, otherwise known as Oni, are terrifying demon-like beings that are well known for their superhuman strength and hexes. While there are many living peaceful and civilized lives in the booming industries of the Western Skylands of Baihu, there are still a numerous few, though increasingly rarer, with a propensity for murder and bloodshed. The most common of Daemonsouls you'd see have red, black, or white skin tones but other hues also exist that are exceptionally exotic and rare such as blue or yellow.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their early teens and live for many centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Fey.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Three main subraces of Daemonsoul populate Saratola: Red Daemon, Black Daemon, White Daemon. Choose one of these subraces.

race.name: Tempestsoul
entries: Tempestsouls, otherwise known as Tengu, are all-powerful bird-like beings that find themselves most comfortable living in mountainous regions. Different skylands have different perceptions of the tengu, while the Western Skylands of Baihu see them as guardian spirits of the mountains, the Southern Skylands of Zhuque have a more wild perception of them, seeing the tengu as destructive demons and harbingers of war.

Within the two opposite sides of the spectrum, these beliefs still hold a little bit of the truth within them when discussing the origins of the Tengu, there are those that believe them to be natives of the Mountains of Baihu but there are also those that believe them to be the offspring of Zhuque herself.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their early teens and live for many centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Fey.

entries.name: Tengu's Speed
entries: You have a walking speed of 40 feet and at 3rd level, you gain a pair of elemental wings that you can use to fly with.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Walking Tempest
entries: You know the {@spell gust|XGE} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the expeditious retreat spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell gust of wind} spell; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Three main subraces of Tempestsoul populate Saratola: Of Wind, Of Lightning, and Of Clouds. Choose one of these subraces.

race.name: Wildersoul
entries: Also known as 'Children Blessed by Nature', Wildersoul are a type of Yokai that are closely linked to the natural elements that are ever-present in Saratola. The most common of these are the Kitsune, blessed by fire, the Kappas, blessed by water, the Kamaitachi, blessed by winds, and the Kudan, blessed by earth.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their early teens and live for many centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an Elemental. You are also considered a Fey.

entries.name: Kinship By Blood
entries: A wildersoul will always know if a creature that they can see is a wildersoul as long as they belong to the same subrace.

entries.name: Shy Spirits
entries: As an action, wildersouls can hide and replace the physical traits that are common for their kind such as the vulpine features of a kitsune, carapace and dish of a kappa, weasel-like features of a kamaitachi, and the horns of a kudan. By using this feature, wildersouls can appear as a normal human or adopt more particular physical traits such as pointy ears, colored sclera, long-flowing hair and beards, and et cetera.
This is counted as an illusion with a spell slot level equal to your proficiency bonus but is not considered as a spell effect for the purposes of dispelling and identifying.

race.name: Tsukumogami
entries: Tsukumogami are a type of yokai, being tools that have acquired a spirit and soul. There are many different folklore that depict the manifestation of tsukumogami, whether it be the tragedy of loss, or the findings of hope, all of these are very much tied to what it means of being human and seeking the answers to the age-old question.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their early teens and live for many centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Living Tool
entries: Being a tsukumogami, your original form is of a tool. This can either be a trinket, tool, artisan's tools, or a weapon of your choice.

As an action, you can transform back to your original form or your humanoid form. While in your original form, you retain all of your statistics and proficiencies. Your hit points instead becomes 5 times your character level and you have an AC of 10. You revert to your humanoid form if you are knocked unconscious as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your humanoid form.
You can't cast spells and any actions that requires hands is prohibited while in your original form but you retain your ability to speak and all of your special senses.
You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space or merges into your new form.
At 7th level, you become a +1 variant of your original form when transforming into it which increases to a +2 at 11th, and a +3 at 15th.
You can transform into your original form twice per long rest.

entries.name: Function Over Form
entries: You gain proficiency for the object chosen as your original form. Items that are neither a tool or a weapon are treated as an improvised weapon.
If your original form is a tool, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using it.
If your original form is a weapon, you can use the chosen weapon as your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Age
entries: You do not age.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Headless Horseman
entries: Your head and your body are separated, the wound that separated them permanently scarred. You gain the following effects:

items: You can attach and detach your head using your Object Interaction. Your ability to sever your head prevents you from being killed by decapitation, however, being struck by a critical hit by a weapon attack or unarmed strike causes your head to fly off. Your head lands in a space within 10 feet of you.
You always know the distance and direction to your head or body unless it is on another plane of existence or if it's blocked by an effect that prevents divination magic.

Unless your head is being carried by your body or another creature, it can be targeted, its AC being equal to yours but without the benefit of Dexterity or armor that does not include a helmet. You cannot be damaged twice by an area of effect due to this. Your head automatically fails Dexterity saving throws.
When separate, your body can see and hear so long as your head can see the body. If your head's vision is obscured, your body gains 10 feet of blindsight.
Your headless body cannot speak but it can consume food and drink as well as cast spells, even spells with verbal components as long as the separated head is not silenced or gagged.

entries.name: The Wild Hunt
entries: You can cast {@spell toll the dead|xge} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell find steed} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell phantom steed} spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Endless Conquest
entries: You and a mount that you are riding do not need to sleep.

entries.name: Ghost Rider Fury
entries: When holding your head using one hand, the other hand can wield two-handed weapons as normal.

entries.name: Weakness To Gold
entries: You have vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from gold plated weapons. If you are carrying or touching anything made of gold, make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or release the item. Repeat this save every turn you carry the gold.

race.name: Ramisaa
entries: Whether descended from an infernal being or infused with fiendish power, ramisaa are mortals who carry a spark of the Helas Cosmos within their souls. They can fan that spark to bring light, ease wounds, and unleash the fury of hell.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your race reaches adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Harming Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d8s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature takes necrotic damage equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Infernal Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and fire damage.

entries.name: Infernal Revelation
entries: When you reach 3rd level, choose one of the revelation options below. Thereafter, you can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of that revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation below, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items: {@b {@i Infernal Shroud.}} Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and ghostly, flightless wings sprout from your back temporarily. Creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra fire damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

{@b {@i Hellish Consumption.}} Your eyes bleed tears of flame and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra fire damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

{@b {@i Hellish Soul.}} Two impish bat wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra fire damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

race.name: Fallen
entries: Death comes for all things in a near-infinite variety of ways. So, too, are there many reasons that the dead might return from the grave. Directly-applied necromancy, cursed lands, and unfinished business are but a few, and all leave the newly-undead soul with a mere semblance of the life it had before. All undead carry the physical or emotional scars of what ended their mortal lives, though some may be far more subtle than others.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, 25 feet if you are Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Through the necromantic energy animating you, you are able to perceive with greater clarity that which lurks in the darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dead Immortality
entries: You do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit dice function as normal.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been raised from death, but regaining your autonomy has returned to you some of the spark of life. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish.

entries.name: Restless
entries: As an undead, you very rarely tire. You treat exhaustion as if it was one level less. In addition, instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Unholy
entries: Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you only receive half as many hit points as the source would normally provide, rounded down.

entries.name: Bloodless
entries: You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet. When using your flying speed from this source, you cannot end your turn more than 5 feet above a solid surface, and gently descend down to this distance at a speed of 60 feet per round if you are any higher.

entries.name: Withering Touch
entries: Your unarmed strike deals necrotic damage instead of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take 1d10 force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space. After passing through a physical barrier, you must complete a short or long rest before you are able to do so again.

entries.name: Intangible
entries: You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You possess both claws and fangs, either of which you can use as an unarmed strike. Your fangs deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, while your claws deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your choice of either your Strength or Dexterity modifier. In addition, you can use Dexterity in place of Strength for attack rolls made with your claws.

entries.name: Feeding
entries: Though undead do not need to eat to continue existing, you are compelled through a dark curse to feed. As an action when you are adjacent to a dead or prone creature that is not an aberration, construct, elemental, ooze, plant, or undead, you can render yourself prone as well and attempt to feed on them.

If the creature is alive, make an unarmed strike attack with your fangs, dealing damage on a hit as usual. If this attack hits, or if the creature is already dead, you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier + your total character level. Once you successfully use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest. You still feel hunger, and can feed on flesh without regaining hit points, however.

entries.name: Curse of the Abyss
entries: Ghouls were created to feed, and suffer a compulsion to do so. If a creature you can see drops to 0 hit points and you have not used your Feeding ability since your last long rest, you must attempt a Wisdom saving throw with a DC of 15 - half your total character level, rounded down, unless that creature is of a creature type that cannot be fed upon.

If you fail this saving throw, on each of your turns you must move to the creature by the shortest possible distance, using the Dash action if necessary. Once you reach the creature, you are compelled to use your Feeding ability with it as the target. You can repeat this Wisdom saving throw on each of your turns, This compulsion ends when you succeed on this saving throw, or after you have successfully fed upon the triggering creature.

entries.name: Paralytic Claws
entries: When you hit a creature that is not undead or an elf with an attack using your claws, you can attempt to paralyze them. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. If the creature fails, it is incapacitated and unable to use its movement until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability successfully, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Mummy Rot
entries: You can choose to make your unarmed strike deal necrotic damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and any creature hit by your unarmed strike is unable to regain hit points until the end of your next turn. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by your unarmed strike, it instantly disintegrates into dust, leaving behind any objects, clothing, or items on its person.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. This creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. If it fails, this creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability successfully, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Canopic Resurrection
entries: Your heart has been removed from your person, and stored in a canopic jar in a safe location. While your heart is intact and within this jar, you can reroll one death saving throw you have made. If you roll a 17 or higher on this rerolled saving throw, treat the result as if it was a natural 20. Once you reroll a death saving throw with this trait, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

entries.name: Dead Fortitude
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can pull upon the necromantic force animating you to gain temporary hit points equal to your total character level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) that last for up to one minute. Once you use this ability, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Tools of the Grave
entries: You gain proficiency with your choice of one of the following sets of tools: alchemist's supplies, calligrapher's supplies, leatherworker's tools, or poisoner's kit.

entries.name: Curse of the Abyss
entries: You know the {@spell chill touch} cantrip. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell ray of enfeeblement} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Choose either Intelligence or Charisma as your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Eternal Vengeance
entries: You know at all times the general direction of and relative distance to a specific intelligent creature of the DM's choosing against whom you seek revenge for your death, even if the creature and you are on different planes of existence. Should this creature die by your hand or that of another, you instantly know, and your DM chooses another creature also responsible for your death for this feature to apply to, should such a creature exist.

entries.name: Driven
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead or would cause you to be frightened.

entries.name: Unnatural Vitality
entries: When you drop to 0 hit points, you can choose to stay conscious instead of falling unconscious. If you do, you gain temporary hit points equal to your total character level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), which last for up to one minute.

In this state, you can take an action or bonus action on your turn, but not both, and can move only half of your movement speed. You remain in this state until you regain hit points, or until you no longer have temporary hit points. If you lose all temporary hit points in this state while you are still at 0 hit points, you fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws as normal.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Bone Pile
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do, you reduce yourself to a pile of bones, render yourself prone, and are considered to be under a similar effect to the feign death spell. While subject to this condition, you are unable to move or take actions other than using an action to end this effect. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Them Bones
entries: Whenever both of your hands are unoccupied, you can use a bonus action to rearrange the bones in your body, or to return your body to its original configuration. When you rearrange your bones, choose one of the following options, any of which are considered to occupy both of your hands:

items: {@b {@i Bone Club.}} You remove an arm and use it as a boneclub. While used as a weapon, you have proficiency with your removed arm, which is a melee weapon with the finesse property that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage on a hit.

{@b {@i Bone To Pick.}} You remove a hand, and hold it in your other hand as if it were a set of thieves' tools. This hand is capable of picking locks, cutting glass, and any other function thieves' tools could achieve.
{@b {@i Bone Xylophone.}} You remove two of your ribs and use the rest of your remaining ribs as a musical instrument, with which you have proficiency.

entries: At your DM's discretion, you can use this trait to perform other tasks, such as juggling your own bones, removing your skull to look around a corner or over a wall, or similar. Your bones lose their animation if they are further than 5 feet from the majority of your body, and must be reattached before they are once again a part of you. If your skull loses animation, you are blinded and deafened until a skull is affixed to your body.

entries.name: Olympian Wake
entries: Choose a 1st-level spell from the cleric spell list. You can cast that spell with this trait, without requiring any material components. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Splash Shot
entries: Once per turn, if you hit a creature with a ranged attack, you may select another creature adjacent to it. That creature takes damage equal to your proficiency level.

entries.name: Stained Glass Wings
entries: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Sniping Mark
entries: Any ranged attack roll you make has its ranges increased by 30 feet.

entries.name: Fast Hands
entries: You ignore the loading property of firearms.

entries.name: Divine Accuracy
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made using a ranged weapon.

entries.name: Goliath Legacy
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra damage to one target when you deal damage to it with a melee weapon attack. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Vampire Legacy
entries: You don't need to breathe and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed that allows you to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings while leaving your hands free. You also can use your fanged bite as a natural weapon. You add your Constitution modifier instead of your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this bite. It deals 1d6 piercing damage on a hit and you regain hit points equal to the piercing damage dealt.

entries.name: Hematophage Mark
entries: Over the course of a short rest, you can brand an adjacent creature with your blessing. You always know where this marked creature is even from a mile away and you additionally know if a creature is marked in this way. Marking another creature while you already have one marked removes the previous mark.

entries.name: Wendigo Legacy
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. While you are conscious, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of your turn.

entries.name: Banshee Legacy
entries: You can give any spell that you can cast a verbal component. When you cast a spell with a verbal component, your spellcasting modifier increases by 1, you gain this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses after a long rest.

entries.name: Gargoyle Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip. You learn a list of spells that you can cast with trait without requiring a material component. These spells are as follows: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell earthen disk|SeanTerraElementalistsPocketbook} spell; Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell sandbar|ABYSS} spell; Starting at 7th level, you can cast the {@spell meld into stone} spell; Starting at 9th level, you can cast the {@spell swirling rubble|SeanTerraElementalistsPocketbook} spell. Once you cast these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Nachzehrer Legacy
entries: You are immune to most diseases and have resistance to poison damage. Once per turn, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one adjacent target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra necrotic damage equals your level. The range for this feature increases to 30 feet under total darkness. You can only use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Diablo Legacy
entries: You are immune to fire damage. In addition, fire damage you deal ignores resistance.

entries.name: Djall Legacy
entries: You can cast the {@spell command} spell at will. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell at will.

entries.name: Bellua Evolution
entries: You gain one feat of your choice as long as the chosen {@filter feat|feats|ability bonus=str;dex;con} increases a Physical score by 1. Additionally, when you jump, you can extend your jump by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Piscine Evolution
entries: You gain one feat of your choice as long as the chosen {@filter feat|feats|ability bonus=int;wis;cha} increases a Mental score by 1. You have a walking speed of 35 and additionally, you gain a swimming speed and flying speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Woeful White
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical bludgeoning damage in a 15-foot cone as a torrent of rocks manifest alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature that is Large or smaller is knocked prone. The area affected in your spiritual breath is turned into difficult terrain.

entries.name: Resistant and Withstanding
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Grieving Green
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical force damage in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide as gusts of wind blow alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Constitution saving throw. Choose a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier, they instead regain hit points equal to the total amount of damage that your breath weapon will deal.

entries.name: Wise and Learnt
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Baleful Blue
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical cold damage in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide as shards of sharpened ice fly alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Dexterity saving throw. You add double your Constitution modifier to the damage of your spiritual breath.

entries.name: Bold and Sinister
entries: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Raging Red
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical fire damage in a 15-foot cone as a torment of fire blows alongside your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes damage equal to half of your Constitution modifier (rounded up) at the start of their turn as flames begin to alight their body. That creature or one within 5 ft. of it can use their action to douse the flames.

entries.name: Resolute and Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in simple weapons and two martial weapons of your choice. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Feywild's Command
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical radiant damage in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide as the mysticism of the Feywild lends its strength to your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded until the end of their next turn as the light of the Feywild covers the creatureâ€™s eyes.

entries.name: Watcher of the Feywild
entries: You can cast detect magic at will, without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Shadowfell's Command
entries: Your breath weapon deals magical necrotic damage in a 15-foot cone as the mysticism of the Shadowfell lends its strength to your spiritual breath. Your breath weapon imposes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded until the end of their next turn as the darkness of the Shadowfell obstructs the creatureâ€™s eyes.

entries.name: Watcher of the Shadowfell
entries: The range of your darkvision is increased by 60 feet. In addition to this, you have blindsense with a range of 15 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Heavy-Handed
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Oni Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in all martial and simple melee weapons that have the Two-Handed and Heavy properties.

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: As a reaction to being attacked, you may shift into a shadowy version of yourself. You force a reroll on the attack and afterwards you may teleport to an area in dim light or darkness up to 60 ft. away from yourself. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Blending With The Night
entries: While in dim light or darkness, you can use a bonus action to become invisible until the start of your next turn, you make an attack, cast a spell, deal damage, or force a creature to make a saving throw. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You canâ€™t duplicate the appearance of a creature youâ€™ve never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment arenâ€™t changed by this trait.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Tempered Breeze
entries: You gain proficiency in an artisan's tools of your choice and you additionally gain proficiency in simple weapons.

entries.name: Swirling Tempest
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash your elemental strength and unfurl your wings.
Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed that is doubled if you are outdoors in windy conditions.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Dai Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in greatswords, longswords, rapiers, scimitars, and shortswords.

entries.name: Booming Tempest
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash your elemental strength and unfurl your wings.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed that is doubled if you are outdoors in stormy conditions, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra lightning damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra lightning damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Calming Presence
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion. Additionally, you learn one language of your choice and you gain proficiency in an instrument of your choice.

entries.name: Cumulus Tempest
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash your elemental strength and unfurl your wings.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. At the start of your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to five times your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Kitsune's Charm and Cunning
entries: You learn the {@spell friends} cantrip. Additionally, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, Performance, or Persuasion.

entries.name: Foxfire
entries: You learn the {@spell produce flame} cantrip. As a reaction to yourself dealing fire damage, you can cause all creatures and objects that took fire damage to be burnt by a lingering ember (typically a light shade of blue). At the start of their next turn, the embers torch the creature, dealing fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kitsune
entries: You can only alter your appearance through this feature if your vulpine traits are well-groomed. While disguised, it is undone if your rear is drenched in water, or if it is affected by a strong wind capable of extinguishing flames.

entries.name: Kappa's Knowledge and Strength
entries: You gain proficiency in the Medicine and Athletics skills if you don't already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

You have a tough carapace on your back. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

Additionally, you have a cap on your head filled with water called a sara. If your dish spills all of its contents (by being knocked unconscious and et cetera), you suffer one level of exhaustion. Each time you finish a long rest without a water-filled dish on your head, you suffer one level of exhaustion. You can recover from this exhaustion only through magic or by refilling the dish and placing it back atop your head. If you lose the dish, you can use any suitable substitute which would then transform into your natural dish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kappa
entries: You can only alter your appearance through this feature if your sara is filled to the brim with water. While disguised, it is undone if the top of your head is in a position wherein your sara would typically empty its contents.

entries.name: Kamaitachi's Sharpness and Havoc
entries: You have two natural weapons that you can emerge from your limbs as a short sickle-like blade as a bonus action. It deals 1d6 slashing damage on a hit and has the Finesse and Light properties. When making an attack using the natural weapon, you can make one additional weapon attack with it as part of that action. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Martial skill.

entries.name: Dust Scikles
entries: You learn the {@spell dust devil|XGE} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot or using a material component. Casting it this way instead pulls creature into the center of the vortex and the spell deals slashing damage instead of bludgeoning damage. As long as you are within 30 feet of the spell, you can target any creatures within the vortex using your natural weapons. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kamaitachi
entries: You can only alter your appearance through this feature if your sickles are sharp and without any cracks or breaks. While disguised, it is undone if the top of your head is in a position wherein your sara would typically empty its contents.

entries.name: Kudan's Foresight and Warding
entries: You gain proficiency in any Mental skill of your choice and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check that makes use of the proficiency. When you finish a long rest, you can change what Mental skill you have proficiency for and you also know what type of weather it will within 1 mile for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Prophecy
entries: When you finish a long rest, roll a d20 and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

entries.name: Shy Spirits: Kudan
entries: While disguised, it is undone if you lose your ability to speak or if you tell a lie.

feat.name: Arcane Brawn
entries: Choose a class that you have levels in and that has either the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature. Your spellcasting modifier for that class becomes Strength and any class feature coming from the same class that is based on the same ability modifier also is now based on Strength.
Only full casting classes and Warlocks are eligible for this feat.

feat.name: Arcane Leech

otherSummary.entry: Can cast dispel magic or counterspell

entries: You learn how to respool the threads of magic whenever you attempt to unravel them. When you successfully dispel a magical effect with a roll of 19 or higher using one of the prerequisite spells for this feat, you restore a spell slot. This spell slot is either the spell slot that you expended when casting the prerequisite spells or the level of the spell it was casted against, whichever is lower.

feat.name: Archery Master

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with one of the listed weapon types.

entries: Your hours spent dedicated to mastering archery has lead you to perfection in your techniques with bows and slings. You gain the following benefits when using any of them:

items: The short range for your ranged attacks is now equal to its long range.
When you take the Attack action with a ranged weapon on your turn, you can take your bonus action to make one ranged attack with the weapon.
As a bonus action, you can draw your bowstring past its normal length. Doing so increases the damage of your ranged attacks by your proficiency bonus until the end of your turn.

You can load two pieces of ammunition when you make a ranged weapon attack. If you do, you make an additional attack with disadvantage as part of the attack. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses on a long rest.

feat.name: Blade Mastery

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with one of the listed weapon types.

entries: You master the shortsword, longsword, scimitar, rapier, and greatsword. You gain the following benefits when using any of them:

items: When you are taking the Attack action, you can choose one of your attacks to be a feint. This attack is made with advantage but the attack after it has advantage and its critical hit range increases by 1.

On your turn, you can use your reaction to assume a parrying stance, provided you have the weapon in hand. Doing so grants you a +1 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn or until you're not holding the weapon.
When you make an opportunity attack with the weapon, you have advantage on the attack roll.

feat.name: Chained Weapon Mastery

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with one of the listed weapon types.

entries: Chained weapons that rely on momentum are tricky weapons that are wieldy to use, but you have spent countless hours mastering them such as flails, sickles and weights, nunchucks, three-section staves, and meteor hammers. You gain the following benefits when using any of them:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls using these weapons.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can prepare yourself to extend your weapon to sweep over targets' shields. Until the end of this turn, your attacks ignore the AC bonus gained from a shield.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can spinning your weapon to deliver a heavy bludgeoning blow. The next attack you make until the end of this turn gains a bonus to its damage roll equal to your proficiency bonus. If your weapon deals a special transformative damage type, they gain this bonus as well.

feat.name: Combat Ambidexterity

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with one of the listed weapon types.

entries: Versatile weapons are simple to learn but it has many techniques in efficiency that reward you for the time you have taken to master them. You gain the following benefits when using a weapon with the versatility trait:

items: When wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, its damage dice changes to a 1d12 or 2d6, your choice. When wielding a versatile weapon with one hand, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with that weapon.

As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see that is at least 20 feet away from you. If that creature moves within your weapon's reach on its next turn, you can make an attack of opportunity with your weapon as a reaction. If the attack hits, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage, or an extra 1d8 damage if you wield the weapon with two hands.

As an action, you can attempt to lock an opponent out of their weapon. They must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use) with a DC equals to 8 + your bonus to attack rolls with the weapon. On a failure, they cannot make attacks using that weapon on their next turn. If the creature fails this saving throw twice in a row, their weapon is disarmed by you.

feat.name: Concealed Weapon Mastery

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with one of the listed weapon types.

entries: In your hands, smaller blades like daggers are tools of the bloodiest of trades. You gain the following benefits when using a weapon with the concealed trait:

items: Weapons with the concealed trait are always considered hidden as according to your Passive Sleight of Hand.
If a creature attacks you and they miss, you may immediately spend your reaction to attack them with a melee weapon attack.
When you score a critical hit, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.
As long as your speed is not 0, you can move to an adjacent unoccupied space as part of your weapon attacks.

feat.name: Crystalline Magics
entries: You learn to channel a protective force from crystals or orbs akin to their natural dense crystalline structure. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use spellcasting crystals or orbs as a spellcasting focus.
You learn the {@spell shield} spell and you can cast it without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses of this feature on a long rest.
You can cast the {@spell shield} spell on a different creature within 15 feet of you. They have a +3 bonus to their AC, instead of the normal +5, when casted in this way.

feat.name: Deep Magical Pouches
entries: You learn to squeeze out the most of your component pouches when casting spells. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use component pouches as a spellcasting focus.

You can cast any spell with a material component with a cost as if you have the material as long as the monetary cost is up to your proficiency bonus multiplied by 25 gp. The amount is halved if the spell consumes the material component as part of its casting.

feat.name: Devout Focus
entries: Faith and belief are the very tenets of your spellcasting, thus your unswaying foundation in religion strengthens. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use a divine focus as a spellcasting focus.
Once per long rest, you can increase the spellcasting modifier of a spell you cast by a number equal to half your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Dual Wielder (Lolzdux)
entries: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren't light.
You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.
When you use your bonus action to attack with your off-hand, you may do it with both weapons instead but both attacks have a -5 penalty to their attack rolls.

feat.name: Fell Handed

otherSummary.entry: Proficiency with one of the listed weapon types.

entries: You master the handaxe, battleaxe, greataxe, warhammer, and maul. You gain the following benefits when using any of them:

items: Whether you have advantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon and hit, you can knock the target prone if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit. This is only applicable if the target's size is Large or smaller.

Whenever you have disadvantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attacks but the higher of the two d20 rolls would have hit.

If you use the Help action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding the weapon, you knock the target's shield aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the attack ignores the AC bonus gained from a shield.

feat.name: Forces of Nature
entries: The power of nature has its roots embedded from the elemental cosmos and you learn to reap what it has sown. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use a druidic focus as a spellcasting focus.

When you cast a spell that deals either acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage, you can choose to instead deal one of the other damage types listed. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all uses on a long rest.

feat.name: Heroic
entries: Being triumphant through the most arduous hours has shaped you to become someone greater.
When you roll initiative, the party gains a Clash Opportunity. You also do not expend a clash opportunity when you succeed a clash that you initiate using a clash opportunity.

feat.name: Magical Spark
entries: You are imbued with a pure magical energy that you can use for your spellcasting needs.
You gain an additional spell slot of your lowest-level that you can use to cast your spells. You regain this spell slot when you finish a short rest.

feat.name: Rod Specialization
entries: Magical rods tend to be specialized for specific magic, and your experience with them allows you to extract the most out of one spell at a time. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use rods as a spellcasting focus.
Once per long rest, you can increase the level of a spell by up to 2 levels of the expended spell slot when casting it.

feat.name: Swift Incantations

otherSummary.entry: The ability to cast at least one spell

entries: You have practiced focusing on more than one spell at a time, learning techniques that allow you to cast spells in quick succession.

When you cast a spell using an action, you may use a bonus action to cast a spell a spell level no higher than half your proficiency modifier and that the spell has a casting time of an action or a bonus action.

feat.name: Unrestricted Staves
entries: Staves might be larger than their counterparts but they allow more freedom in how you wish to cast spells due to their efficiency in channeling magic. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use staves as a spellcasting focus.

When you cast a spell that forces creatures to make a saving throw, you may instead have those creatures make the saving throw using an ability score of your choice within the same category (Physical or Mental).

feat.name: Wandslinger
entries: Speed and accuracy are emphasized by wands, them being held by your palms and guided by your very finger tips. You gain the following benefits when holding the specified spellcasting focus:

items: You can use wands as a spellcasting focus.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls.

You gain a number of charges equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended charges when you finish a long rest. You can expend a charge to grant yourself advantage on a spell attack roll when you make them.

feat.name: Whip Snapper
entries: You have mastered the art of whipping through dedicated practice. You gain the following benefits when using a whip:

items: You can use hempen ropes, chains or other similar weapons as a whip as long as they are at least 10 feet long. The weapon's reach will always be 10 feet regardless of how long the length of the item is.
You can use your whip to interact with objects within range + 5 feet as if you were using your hands.
While you are wielding a whip, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter your reach.

When you hit a creature no more than one size larger than you with a whip on your turn, you can use a bonus action to make a special melee attack against the target. The target must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (the target chooses the ability to use). If it fails, you either knock the target prone, pull it 5 feet towards you, or it drops one item of your choice that it's holding. You can also use your reaction to move the target 5 feet in any direction or catch the item it drops if it fails the saving throw.
You can make a loud cracking sound as an action. Each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be deafened until the end of their next turn.

entries: The saving throw DC for the features of this feat is calculated as follows: DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)

feat.name: Astute Caster
entries: You have a number of Extemporaneous Spells equal to your proficiency bonus for a spell list that you choose when you take this feat. Extemporaneous spells count as part of your prepared spell list but you may only cast them once until prepared again as an extemporaneous spell. You prepare your extemporaneous spells as part of your short rest.

feat.name: Bodyguard
entries: You strived to develop various techniques and you honed your reflexes in order to safeguard your allies.
